1121788_11_ITEM15_P22_S0	The following exhibits are attached hereto.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P22_S1	See Part IV of this Annual Report on Form 10-K for a complete list of exhibits.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P23_S0	To create leading-edge navigation and communication devices that can enrich our customers' lives through the worldwide collaborative efforts of our colleagues.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P24_S0	We surround ourselves with creative minds and passionate spirits.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P24_S1	We continually invest in innovation through the worldwide collaborative efforts of our colleagues.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P24_S2	Innovation drives our success now and in the future.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P25_S0	We commit to high performance and take personal ownership for the success of our company.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P25_S1	We work together to continually adapt and improve our products.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P26_S0	We are dedicated to serving our customers and design our products with the customer in mind.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P26_S1	Our associates are in the air, on the water, in the woods, behind the wheel, and on the run designing solutions for our customers.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P27_S0	We strive to conduct all of our business dealings with uncompromising integrity and professionalism.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P27_S1	We make and keep our commitments, admit our mistakes, and learn from our experiences.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P28_S0	We work as a team with respect and trust for each other.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P28_S1	We openly and freely share ideas and look for opportunities to help all team members grow.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P28_S2	We strive to extend our team spirit to our communities worldwide.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P29_S0	Garmin was built on the cornerstones of innovation, integrity, and professionalism.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P29_S1	Our future success requires each of our associates to understand and demonstrate these core values:
1121788_11_ITEM15_P30_S0	One of my colleagues is continually late for meetings, both internal and external.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P31_S0	No, it is not professional or respectful to be habitually late for meetings.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P31_S1	It may reflect poorly on Garmin s reputation in external meetings and may give the impression internally that the associate is untrustworthy and not respectful of others.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P32_S0	I received the final version of a contract with a Garmin supplier and noticed a mistake.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P32_S1	The error is favorable to Garmin, but not consistent with our oral agreement.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P33_S0	In many cases, more than one Garmin associate is involved in contract negotiations.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P34_S0	First, talk with other members of the Garmin negotiating team to confirm that your understanding of the oral agreement is correct.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P34_S1	If so, call the mistake to the attention of the Garmin supplier and ask that the contract be changed to reflect the actual agreement of the parties.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P35_S0	We must treat others in a fair and professional manner to maintain their confidence and trust in Garmin.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P36_S0	Since Garmin was founded in 1989, we have worked hard to uphold the highest ethical standards when conducting Garmin-related business.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P36_S1	You will be asked to acknowledge your awareness that every Garmin associate must follow this Code and to affirm your willingness to follow this Code.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P37_S0	The first element of this Code is to conduct business in an honest, fair, and trustworthy manner.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P37_S1	As a Garmin associate, you must:
1121788_11_ITEM15_P38_S0	Garmin s success depends on our ability to maintain the confidence, respect, and trust of Garmin's customers, suppliers, partners, shareholders, and others.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P38_S1	We are committed to acting professionally with integrity, being responsive and accountable, investing in new product development, and remaining a leader in our field.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P39_S0	To attract and retain customers, Garmin associates must understand and try to anticipate their needs.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P39_S1	We satisfy customer needs, such as providing quality and reliable products and superior service, in a legal and ethical manner:
1121788_11_ITEM15_P40_S0	We deal with all suppliers and business partners professionally, ethically, and fairly.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P40_S1	We strive to avoid both impropriety and the appearance of impropriety by conducting Garmin business in good faith and resolving disputes quickly and equitably, when possible.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P40_S2	In our purchasing decisions, negotiations, contract development, and contract administration, we comply with applicable laws and regulations and we expect our business partners to do likewise.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P41_S0	Garmin s suppliers and business partners also must adhere to the highest standards of ethical behavior and regulatory compliance.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P41_S1	We expect our suppliers to provide high-quality services and products, maintain flexibility and cost-effectiveness, and to act with the best interests of Garmin in mind.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P41_S2	We do not accept kickbacks, bribes, or other incentives in return for conducting business with our suppliers.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P42_S0	Gift-giving practices vary around the world.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P42_S1	Gifts are typically given to create goodwill.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P43_S0	In some parts of the world, declining a gift may insult the giver.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P43_S1	On the other hand, accepting a gift may create a conflict of interest or the appearance of impropriety.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P43_S2	To avoid conflicts of interest, we do not (1) solicit gifts from any customer, supplier, business partner, or other person doing business with Garmin, (2) accept high-value gifts unless and until you have consulted with Garmin s Chief Operating Officer and Legal Department and they have reviewed the situation and determined that the gift is appropriate, or (3) give or accept under any circumstances payments, loans, kickbacks, special privileges, or services to current or potential customers, suppliers, or strategic partners.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P44_S0	If we believe we must decline a gift or favor, we politely explain that Garmin policy prohibits us from accepting it.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P44_S1	We keep in mind that in parts of the world where gift-giving is common practice and not accepting a gift could reflect badly on Garmin, it may be appropriate to accept the gift so long as doing so would not violate any laws and would not influence our judgment or in any way discredit Garmin.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P45_S0	Except when working with government employees, we may accept reasonable meals or other reasonably priced forms of entertainment from third parties as a courtesy extended during the normal course of business.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P45_S1	Associates who work with government employees are responsible for knowing and following the local rules and regulations regarding government employee buyer-and seller relationships.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P46_S0	After working on a long and difficult project for a Garmin customer, the customer offered me a very expensive gold watch to thank me for my assistance.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P47_S0	Garmin associates must consider the value of a gift when deciding whether to accept it.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P47_S1	An expensive gold watch typically costs thousands of dollars and would create the appearance of impropriety, as well as possibly impact the associate s judgment in the performance of his or her Garmin duties.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P48_S0	A bicycle racing team that Garmin sponsors just sent me a high-end bicycle to thank me for putting in significant amounts of extra time and hard work on marketing for the race.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P49_S0	A high-end bicycle typically costs one thousand dollars or more.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P49_S1	Accepting such a gift would create the appearance of impropriety and possibly impact your judgment in the performance of your Garmin duties.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P49_S2	You should return the bicycle to the donor with a polite explanation that Garmin policy prohibits you from accepting the gift.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P50_S0	Garmin s business decisions are shaped by its financial and business records.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P50_S1	We must maintain accurate and complete company records.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P50_S2	Transactions between Garmin and outside individuals and organizations must be promptly and accurately entered in our books in accordance with generally accepted accounting practices and principles.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P50_S3	If you have questions about a record or you become aware of records that may be inaccurate or incomplete, you should report the situation immediately to your supervisor.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P50_S4	Garmin does not support or tolerate misrepresenting facts or falsifying records under any circumstances.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P51_S0	Garmin s independent and internal auditors help ensure that the ways in which we conduct business and keep records are consistent with relevant accounting standards.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P51_S1	All Garmin associates must cooperate with the company s auditors.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P52_S0	As a public company we apply standards of full, fair, accurate, understandable, and timely disclosure in reports filed with or submitted to the Securities and Exchange Commission and in all other public communications.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P52_S1	We establish and maintain clear, open, and honest communications, building our relationships on trust, respect, and mutual understanding.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P52_S2	We are accountable and responsive to our customers, colleagues, and business partners.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P52_S3	Our advertising, sale, and marketing materials are truthful, accurate, and free from false claims.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P53_S0	An outside service provider offered me tickets to the Super Bowl game.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P54_S0	Garmin has serious concerns about high-value gifts because they may be viewed by others as an attempt to influence your business decisions.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P54_S1	Before accepting any high-value gift, you must consult with Garmin s Chief Operating Officer and Legal Department so they can review the situation and determine whether the activity is appropriate.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P55_S0	After working on a long and difficult project for a Garmin customer, the customer offered me an expensive gold watch to thank me for my assistance.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P56_S0	Garmin associates may not accept a gift offered in connection with their job if doing so may impact their judgment in the performance of their Garmin duties or create the appearance of impropriety.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P56_S1	Associates must consider the value of a gift when deciding whether to accept it.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P57_S0	At Garmin, we must keep up with developments in our industry, including obtaining information about our competitors and their products.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P57_S1	We obtain this information only through honest, ethical, and legal methods.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P58_S0	We are a global company and must comply with the laws of many countries.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P58_S1	Each of us is responsible for knowing and following all applicable laws and regulations.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P58_S2	We are also responsible for preventing, detecting, and reporting violations of laws and regulations to Garmin s Legal Department.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P59_S0	We must comply not only with the letter of the law, but also with the spirit.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P59_S1	If this Code or Garmin Guidelines differ from local laws and regulations, we always follow the higher standard.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P59_S2	If you believe any part of this Code conflicts with local law, you should consult Garmin s Legal Department.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P59_S3	Typical legal matters relating to Garmin business include:
1121788_11_ITEM15_P60_S0	Because Garmin is a global business, we are subject to laws and regulations designed to promote fair competition and encourage ethical and legal behavior among competitors.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P60_S1	Antitrust laws and fair competition laws generally prohibit any activity that restrains free trade and limits competition.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P60_S2	We conduct Garmin business in accordance with these laws.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P60_S3	Violating antitrust laws could result in substantial criminal penalties for both Garmin and the individual involved.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P61_S0	In all countries where Garmin conducts business, we are committed to competing vigorously but fairly for suppliers and customers.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P61_S1	To avoid possible antitrust violations, we must not:
1121788_11_ITEM15_P62_S0	Require inappropriate conditions on purchases or sales of Garmin products.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P63_S0	If you have questions about fair competition or antitrust matters, contact Garmin s Legal Department.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P64_S0	One of our dealers in France wants to talk with other dealers about unit prices and has asked for my help.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P65_S0	No. Discussions among dealers could lead to charges of price fixing, which is a violation of competitive laws.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P65_S1	Always seek legal advice from Garmin's Legal Department regarding any situations about product pricing or other potentially anti-competitive matters.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P66_S0	A customer has asked me to certify that one of our Garmin products was not manufactured in Israel.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P67_S0	Providing this type of certification would violate the U.S. anti-boycott regulations.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P67_S1	You should not respond to any boycott-related requests without first contacting the Garmin Legal Department for guidance.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P68_S0	I am a Garmin associate but do not work in the United States.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P68_S1	In my country, it is customary to pay government officials to obtain business.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P69_S0	Even though it is an accepted way of doing business in your country, payments to government officials may well violate the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P69_S1	You should consult Garmin s Legal Department.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P70_S0	Garmin complies with the anti-corruption laws of the countries in which it does business, including the United States Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA).
1121788_11_ITEM15_P70_S1	These bribery and anti-corruption laws are intended to prevent companies and individuals from gaining an unfair advantage through bribes, kickbacks and other corrupt activities.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P70_S2	We must never offer or accept bribes, kickbacks or other illegal payments.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P70_S3	We will not participate in or facilitate any type of corrupt activities.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P71_S0	When choosing contractors, consultants or other business partners, we must never engage a third party who or which may attempt to offer a bribe or kickback to conduct Garmin business.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P71_S1	Neither Garmin nor any of its agents, partners, or representatives will make any improper direct or indirect payments or promises of payment to foreign government officials.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P71_S2	When working with governments, consult with Garmin s Legal Department to be certain you understand any special rules that may apply.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P72_S0	Garmin is a global business, with relationships in most of the world s countries.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P72_S1	The laws governing imports and exports differ in every country.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P72_S2	These laws and regulations cover more than just physical shipments.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P72_S3	They also apply to electronic transfers of technical data, software and technology, as well as the provision of services over the Internet.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P72_S4	In some cases, Garmin may need to obtain an export license or other governmental approval before it may ship or transfer an item.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P73_S0	Garmin must comply with import and export regulations and requirements when engaging in international trade.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P73_S1	We must be aware of import and export regulations and requirements, especially if we are involved in those aspects of Garmin s business.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P74_S0	In addition to obvious importing examples such as importing parts or products into the United States or another country, some importing situations are very subtle.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P74_S1	For example, the shipment of marketing samples or the calculation of product intercompany prices for sales of Garmin products in another country may have import implications.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P75_S0	A failure to comply with the law - even an inadvertent failure - can result in significant fines, penalties, imprisonment, and/or a loss of import or export privileges, as well as customs scrutiny and delays.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P76_S0	If Company A is publicly traded and Garmin s proposed acquisition has not been announced, if your sister buys or sells Company A stock based on your tip, you both could be charged with insider trading.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P77_S0	A dealer asked me to ship Garmin products to another country.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P77_S1	I have not shipped Garmin products to that country before.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P78_S0	It is important for Garmin associates involved in international trade to be aware of applicable laws and regulations for different countries.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P78_S1	In many cases, the law requires an export license or other governmental approvals before an item may be shipped or transferred.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P78_S2	Violations, even inadvertent ones, could result in significant fines and penalties, denied export licenses, loss of export privileges or customs delays.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P78_S3	You should seek advice from Garmin's Legal Department before making the shipment.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P79_S0	When doing business for Garmin or in discussions with Garmin s customers, vendors, or business partners, we may become aware of material non-public information about Garmin or the other organization.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P79_S1	Many countries have insider trading laws that prohibit or restrict securities trading and other activities by a person who has material, non-public information.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P79_S2	Information is deemed material if there is a substantial likelihood that a reasonable investor would consider it important when deciding whether to buy, sell, or hold the company s securities.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P80_S0	If we have material, non-public information about Garmin or another company, we must not:
1121788_11_ITEM15_P81_S0	Share the information with others who may buy or sell securities because of the material, non-public information (also known as tipping ).
1121788_11_ITEM15_P82_S0	Because of the severe penalties associated with insider trading and tipping, contact Garmin s Legal Department before buying or selling public securities in these situations.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P82_S1	Garmin also has guidelines and policies to help us comply with securities law requirements.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P82_S2	Please refer to the Insider Trading Policy included in Garmin s FRM-435 (Associate Handbook) for more details.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P83_S0	Garmin s intellectual property rights are critical to the protection of its product innovations and ideas.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P83_S1	We comply with the intellectual property laws that govern the rights to protect our own and others trademarks, copyrights, trade secrets, patents, and other forms of intellectual property.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P84_S0	We do not transmit, copy, or reproduce protected intellectual property (such as artwork, music, videos, photos, and software) unless we have a valid authorization or license.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P84_S1	We do not ask or encourage others to use or disclose confidential or proprietary information unless they are authorized to do so by the owner of the information.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P85_S0	We use Garmin s confidential information (and that of others) only for business purposes.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P85_S1	We disclose the information only to those who need to know it in the course of their employment with Garmin.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P85_S2	Even if we leave our jobs at Garmin, we must continue to protect the confidential information of Garmin (or, if applicable, another party) and not use it to the detriment of Garmin or such third party or disclose it to third parties without authorization.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P86_S0	Garmin strives to reduce the environmental impact of its products and manufacturing technologies.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P86_S1	We have a responsibility to understand and follow environmental laws, standards, requirements, and policies that apply to our worldwide business operations and products.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P87_S0	Garmin also expects its suppliers and other business partners to comply with applicable environmental laws in their business operations.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P88_S0	The United States and many other countries have enacted privacy laws, which set out the rules for protecting an individual s personal data.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P88_S1	Garmin strives to protect the reasonable privacy expectations of its customers, associates, and other business partners.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P89_S0	We each have a duty to comply with Garmin s privacy and information security requirements if personal data is collected, shared, stored, processed, or transmitted.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P89_S1	If you have questions or concerns about privacy matters, consult Garmin s Legal Department.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P90_S0	Garmin s securities are publicly traded.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P90_S1	As a result, Garmin must comply with various securities laws governing public disclosure of information to investors and the public.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P90_S2	These laws are designed to promote transparency in the U.S. financial markets.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P91_S0	If you are responsible for preparing the reports that Garmin submits to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission or contributing information for such reports, you must ensure that the company s disclosures are accurate, complete and fair.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P92_S0	Because of these disclosure requirements, only a small number of associates authorized by Garmin may make public statements on behalf of Garmin.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P92_S1	If a reporter or other third party calls you regarding Garmin business, refer the caller to Garmin s Investor Relations Manager or Chief Financial Officer.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P93_S0	My manager has asked me several times to meet for a drink after work.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P93_S1	Each time, I have refused, but he/she continues to ask.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P93_S2	I am concerned this may hurt my career.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P94_S0	If you have concerns, contact your local Human Resources representative.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P95_S0	We are using a low-cost supplier for Garmin parts.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P95_S1	The supplier offers good quality, reliable delivery and great prices, but I am uncomfortable with the working and living conditions it provides to its workers.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P96_S0	Immediately report the matter to your manager for investigation.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P97_S0	Garmin s reputation depends on doing business with suppliers and other business partners who treat their workers fairly and responsibly.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P98_S0	I am disabled and have been asked to attend an offsite team-building meeting at a site that is not wheel-chair accessible.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P99_S0	Reasonable accommodations will be made to provide you with access and full participation in the meeting.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P100_S0	We work as a team and treat each other fairly.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P100_S1	We strive to be open, honest, and respectful in sharing our ideas and thoughts and in receiving input from others.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P101_S0	Garmin supports a diverse work force at all levels of the company.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P101_S1	We strive to support the cultural and ethnic diversity of our workforce in order to promote a cooperative and productive work environment.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P101_S2	We believe a diverse group of colleagues is valuable to Garmin s ability to create innovative new products and services.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P102_S0	Garmin is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all qualified associates and applicants.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P102_S1	We do not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, sex, sexual orientation, religion, national origin, marital status, age, disability, or veteran status in any personnel practice, including recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, and discipline.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P102_S2	We take allegations of harassment and unlawful discrimination seriously and address all concerns raised regarding this policy.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P102_S3	Please refer to the EEO Policies section of Garmin s FRM-435 (Associate Handbook) for more details.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P103_S0	Garmin does not tolerate conduct that creates an offensive or intimidating work environment such as (a) racial, religious, sexual, or ethnic jokes or comments; (b) unwelcome sexual advances or inappropriate physical contact; or (c) unwelcome sexually-oriented gestures, pictures, statements, or jokes.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P103_S1	Please refer to the Anti-Harassment section of FRM-435 (Associate Handbook) for more details.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P104_S0	Garmin believes a clean and safe work environment is important to all associates, as well as to Garmin s business operations.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P104_S1	We comply with safety laws and appropriate standards that apply to Garmin s business.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P104_S2	Please refer to Garmin s FRM-437 (Safety and Security Handbook) for more details.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P105_S0	I have occasionally overheard my co-workers making racial and sexual comments.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P105_S1	but I don t want to be viewed as a non-team player or lose my job.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P106_S0	Racial and sexual comments of any kind are unprofessional and likely to offend others.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P106_S1	Garmin does not tolerate comments by its associates, customers, or suppliers that are racial or sexual in nature or which are offensive, vulgar, or belittling of others.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P106_S2	That is not our culture and is unacceptable.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P106_S3	Associates who encounter such situations should contact senior management or file an anonymous report using the procedures in the Code of Conduct.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P106_S4	All good faith reports are investigated immediately.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P106_S5	Garmin does not allow retaliation against associates who in good faith report concerns under the Code.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P107_S0	My spouse owns a small printing company and has asked me whether he can market its services to Garmin.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P108_S0	So long as neither you nor your spouse uses your Garmin relationship to influence in any way the outcome of the marketing activity, this is acceptable.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P108_S1	However, you must first disclose to Garmin management that the proposed printing supplier is owned by your spouse and you cannot be involved in or influence Garmin s selection of a printing company.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P109_S0	My son recently graduated from college and will have to move back home if he does not find employment soon.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P109_S1	He said he might enjoy working at Garmin.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P110_S0	Your child is free to apply for a job at Garmin.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P110_S1	You may not, however, use your position to influence the hiring process in any way.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P110_S2	If your child is hired by Garmin, he may not report to you.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P111_S0	At Garmin, I am a software engineer developing software for our automotive products.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P112_S0	Generally, you are prohibited from engaging in any outside employment that is substantially similar to your job at Garmin.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P113_S0	My spouse works for a large company that makes GPS devices and competes with Garmin.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P114_S0	It may be, depending on your spouse s position.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P114_S1	You should disclose this relationship to your manager.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P114_S2	You also should be especially careful to protect Garmin s proprietary and confidential information.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P115_S0	I own stock in a Garmin competitor.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P116_S0	Not necessarily it depends on the amount of stock that you own.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P116_S1	A small financial interest in a competing public company does not necessarily result in a conflict of interest.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P116_S2	Owning shares of a mutual fund that invests in a competitor s securities is also not considered a conflict of interest.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P117_S0	One of Garmin s outside service providers invited my spouse and me to dinner and a concert.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P118_S0	You must use discretion and good judgment when accepting gifts or entertainment in business settings.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P118_S1	In most cases, it is acceptable to attend cultural and sporting events and to have occasional reasonable business meals with customers and suppliers so long as they are not too frequent and the expense is not excessive.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P119_S0	I travel around the world on Garmin business.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P120_S0	You may keep frequent flyer credits and use them for personal travel.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P120_S1	However, you may not influence or change the travel plans made by Garmin s authorized travel agents to receive these benefits.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P121_S0	I am traveling to Germany for Garmin business.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P121_S1	My spouse, who is not a Garmin associate, would like to accompany me.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P121_S2	The supplier that I am visiting has offered to pay my spouse s travel expenses.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P122_S0	You are responsible for expenses generated by having your spouse travel with you.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P123_S0	In most circumstances, Garmin associates may give inexpensive promotional items or gifts.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P123_S1	Garmin associates may not, however, give gifts to any distributor or supplier that may influence, or create the appearance of an attempt to influence, the judgment of the supplier or distributor in its business dealings with Garmin.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P124_S0	As a government contractor providing its commercial products and services to Federal agencies, Garmin is subject to certain heightened ethics requirements.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P124_S1	The Federal Acquisition Regulation ( FAR ) rules on mandatory disclosure, and ethics and compliance require Garmin in certain circumstances, to disclose evidence of violations of criminal laws by a principal, associate, agent, or sub-contractor and to implement certain internal controls within the Company.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P125_S0	These Government Contractor Compliance rules require, for contracts and solicitations after Dec. 12, 2008, the insertion of the clause at FAR 52.203-13, Contractor Code of Business Ethics and Conduct, in all contracts in which the value of the contract is expected to exceed $5 million and the performance period is 120 days or more (a "covered contract").
1121788_11_ITEM15_P126_S0	Garmin, through its Legal Department, is required to make timely disclosures to the agency Office of the Inspector General and/or the Federal government contracting officer or other prescribed Federal official when the Company has credible evidence that a principal, associate, agent or sub-contractor, in connection with the award, performance, or close-out of a Federal government contract or sub-contract: (i) has committed a violation of federal criminal law involving fraud, conflict of interest, bribery, or gratuity violations in Title 18 of the U.S. Code; (ii) has committed a violation of the civil False Claims Act; or (iii) the Company has received a significant overpayment by the government in connection with a Federal government contract.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P126_S1	The rule also creates a basis for suspension and debarment from contracting if Garmin fails to timely disclose credible evidence of violations.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P127_S0	Garmin is required to, and does, have in place a written Code of Business Conduct and Ethics (this document) and certain internal controls.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P127_S1	This Code of Business Conduct and the internal controls are intended to be reasonable and effective efforts to, among other things, prevent the hiring or promotion as a principal any person whom due diligence would have exposed as having engaged in conduct that conflicts with Garmin's code of business ethics and conduct; prevent the Company from doing business with sub-contractors with poor records of business integrity and ethics; and promote training for sub-contractors and agents as appropriate.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P128_S0	It is important for all associates to be aware of, and to comply with, these requirements.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P128_S1	Managers and associates should direct questions and report violations to the Legal Department or the anonymous hotline.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P129_S0	Conflicts of interest arise when the personal or family interests of a Garmin associate influence or even appear to influence his or her ability or judgment to act in the best interests of Garmin.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P129_S1	We avoid taking any actions or acquiring interests that may make it difficult to perform our work for Garmin in an objective and effective manner.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P130_S0	When conducting business with third parties on behalf of Garmin, we act in a fair and objective manner, without favor or preferences based upon personal considerations.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P131_S0	As Garmin associates, we do not engage in activities that compete with Garmin s current or proposed products or services.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P131_S1	We do not own a significant interest in any business that does or is seeking to do business with Garmin.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P131_S2	Other situations that may cause conflicts of interest include, among other things, a close relative who works for a Garmin business partner or competitor or as a consulting or part-time position with such company.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P132_S0	Conflicts of interest may arise if we accept any personal benefit that is or could be interpreted as being given to us because of our ability to influence a Garmin decision.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P132_S1	Other examples of improper personal benefits that may lead to conflicts of interest include:
1121788_11_ITEM15_P133_S0	Accepting or offering any entertainment, gifts, favors, or other payments that could be viewed as a bribe.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P134_S0	In both the performance of our duties for Garmin and our outside activities, we seek to avoid the appearance of, as well as an actual, conflict of interest.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P134_S1	If you have a concern about a possible conflict of interest, talk with your immediate supervisor or Garmin s Legal Department.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P134_S2	Any possible conflict of interest must be discussed a failure to disclose a possible conflict is a violation of Garmin policy.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P134_S3	Please refer to the Conduct Discipline Policies Protection of Garmin Property section of FRM-435 (Associate Handbook) for more details.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P135_S0	You should assume the information is confidential and proprietary.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P135_S1	You may then contact your manager or Garmin s Legal Department to help you determine whether the information is confidential and proprietary.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P136_S0	I discovered a misuse and possible infringement of Garmin s trademark on the Internet.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P137_S0	To protect Garmin s rights, you should promptly report the possible misuse and infringement to Garmin s Legal Department.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P138_S0	A distributor s finance manager asked for information about Garmin s sales and financial control procedures for an analysis her company is preparing.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P139_S0	Requests for Garmin financial records must be reviewed on a case-by-case basis.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P139_S1	The release of unauthorized financial information could lead to violation of securities and antitrust laws.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P139_S2	You should contact Garmin s Legal Department for guidance.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P140_S0	I am leaving Garmin to start my own business.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P141_S0	You may not use or disclose Garmin proprietary information even after you are no longer employed by Garmin.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P142_S0	We are responsible for developing, using and protecting Garmin s assets, including funds, property (both physical and intellectual) and Garmin s reputation.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P142_S1	We wisely use and protect Garmin s assets to prevent loss, theft, or unauthorized users.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P143_S0	We use Garmin s assets, including its buildings, equipment, computer and communication systems, to further develop Garmin s business.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P143_S1	On an occasional and limited basis, we may use computer, printer, and communications systems for personal business, so long as there is no negative impact on Garmin s business and our co-workers are not distracted.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P144_S0	At all times, we use good judgment and common sense and conduct ourselves ethically, lawfully and professionally.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P144_S1	Garmin respects associates privacy, but we should not assume that our desk, work station or use of computer or telephone equipment is private or confidential.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P145_S0	Garmin has the right, subject to local laws, to review any material sent, received, or stored on its electronic information exchange systems.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P145_S1	In using these company assets and systems, we do not create, access, store, print, solicit, or send any material that is intimidating, harassing, threatening, abusive, sexually explicit or otherwise offensive or inappropriate, nor do we send any false, derogatory, or malicious communications.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P146_S0	Proprietary information is knowledge that Garmin has determined must not be disclosed to others, except as required by law or permitted by company policy.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P146_S1	Proprietary information includes all non-public information that might be useful to Garmin s competitors or harmful to the company or its customers, including:
1121788_11_ITEM15_P147_S0	Garmin s financial outlooks and projections.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P148_S0	Proprietary information is often in digital form, stored on laptop computers, handheld computers, desktops, and portable storage devices.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P149_S0	We take personal responsibility to safeguard our electronic devices from theft, unauthorized disclosure, or changes.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P149_S1	To protect Garmin s reputation and its investment in proprietary information, we must understand and comply with Garmin s security policies and procedures.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P149_S2	Disclosure of proprietary information could harm Garmin, from both a competitive and a financial standpoint.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P149_S3	It also could embarrass Garmin associates, customers, suppliers, and business partners.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P150_S0	When a legitimate business need to disclose Garmin s proprietary information arises, a legally binding non-disclosure agreement may be appropriate.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P150_S1	Consult with Garmin s Legal Department in these situations.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P151_S0	We are responsible for upholding Garmin s core values reflected in this Code.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P151_S1	We have a duty to uphold Garmin s reputation and refrain from disclosing sensitive information about Garmin or any of our colleagues, business partners or competitors.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P151_S2	When speaking at a meeting or other public setting or posting information on the Internet, we must clarify that we are expressing our own views and not those of Garmin, unless, of course, we are asked to speak as an authorized representative of Garmin.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P152_S0	You are expected to become familiar with Garmin s policies regarding records retention and disposal of Garmin documents and to strictly adhere to those procedures as outlined in the policies.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P153_S0	If a Garmin associate has reason to believe, or Garmin informs an associate, that Garmin records may be relevant to a pending or anticipated litigation matter or government investigation or proceeding, then the Garmin associate must preserve those records until Garmin s Legal Department determines that the records are no longer needed.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P154_S0	If there is any question as to whether a particular Garmin record should be maintained, a Garmin associate should seek guidance from Garmin s Legal Department.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P155_S0	At all times and in all circumstances, all associates are expected to and must pay particular attention to conducting themselves and Garmin s business according to the highest standards of business ethics.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P156_S0	Associates are expected and required to cooperate with all internal investigations and must not destroy or alter any documents or electronic records, lie to or mislead an investigator, or obstruct the collection of information relating to an investigation or any legal action brought on behalf of, or against, the Company.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P156_S1	Any questions about whether a document or record may be disposed of, or whether it is required to be preserved, should be brought to the Legal Department before disposing of, destroying, or releasing the document or record.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P157_S0	It is Garmin's policy to provide full cooperation with government investigators and law enforcement officials.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P157_S1	All inquiries, requests or demands for information from external investigators must be immediately referred to the Legal Department.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P157_S2	The Legal Department will coordinate all responses to external investigators' questions.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P157_S3	Failure to cooperate with legitimate investigations will result in disciplinary action, up to and including termination.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P158_S0	This Code of Conduct applies to all Garmin associates, directors, independent contractors, and agents.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P158_S1	It is our guide and worldwide point of reference for upholding our core values.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P158_S2	Each of us is responsible for understanding this Code of Conduct and complying with it.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P159_S0	We all have a duty to ensure that Garmin business is conducted with integrity and professionalism.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P159_S1	If we know of, observe, suspect, or otherwise become aware of a violation of Garmin policy or this Code, we immediately must report that concern using one of the three methods described in the following paragraph.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P160_S0	This Code cannot address every issue or situation we may face as Garmin associates.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P160_S1	If you are concerned about questionable conduct or wrongdoing at Garmin, you must report the information using one of three options:
1121788_11_ITEM15_P161_S0	Garmin handles all reports seriously and discreetly, carefully investigates the matter and takes appropriate action.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P162_S0	Federal law provides certain whistleblower protections to all employees of government contractors.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P162_S1	No associate shall be discharged, demoted, or otherwise discriminated against as reprisal for disclosing information to the Company, a Member of Congress, or an authorized official of an agency or of the Justice Department, relating to a substantial violation of law under a Federal government contract (including the competition for or negotiation of a contract).
1121788_11_ITEM15_P162_S2	Any restrictions imposed by an associate agreement or nondisclosure agreement shall not supersede associates whistleblower rights under Federal law.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P163_S0	Any associate who in good faith reports a possible violation of this Code will not be subject to dismissal or retaliation of any kind.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P163_S1	Garmin will not tolerate reprisals against people who in good faith report concerns or ask questions about possible violations of Garmin policy or this Code of Conduct.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P164_S0	Garmin will discipline any associate who attempts to retaliate.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P164_S1	Similarly, Garmin will discipline any associates who knowingly make a false report of a possible violation for the purpose of harming another individual.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P165_S0	If you believe you have been the victim of retaliatory action for reporting possible violations of the Code, you should contact a local representative in the Human Resources Department or Garmin s Legal Department.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P166_S0	Garmin investigates all reports of misconduct, including those made anonymously.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P167_S0	First, Garmin forms an investigation team comprised of experts with the right knowledge and objectivity to investigate the concern.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P167_S1	The investigation team determines the facts through interviews and/or document review.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P167_S2	If necessary, the team recommends corrective actions to the appropriate managers.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P167_S3	Finally, the team provides feedback to the person raising the concern, if possible and appropriate.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P168_S0	Garmin associates who violate this Code or the spirit of this Code are subject to disciplinary action up to and including termination of their employment.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P168_S1	Misconduct that may result in discipline includes:
1121788_11_ITEM15_P169_S0	In certain situations, Garmin may find it appropriate to waive a provision of the Code.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P169_S1	To request a waiver, please speak with Garmin s Ethics Officer, who will consider the request in consultation with Garmin s Legal Department and others.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P170_S0	Waivers of this Code for Garmin directors or executive officers may be made only by the Audit Committee of Garmin s Board of Directors, and must be promptly disclosed to the public as required under applicable securities laws and/or applicable NASDAQ rules.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P171_S0	Garmin s success depends on you.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P171_S1	We must all make a commitment to conduct Garmin s business with uncompromising integrity and in compliance with applicable laws and regulatory requirements.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P172_S0	This Code is not an employment contract and confers no rights relating to employment.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P173_S0	Ultimately, we are each responsible for our own conduct.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P173_S1	None of us should ever commit dishonest, destructive, or illegal acts even if directed to do so by a manager or co-worker.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P174_S0	Garmin conducts business around the world.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P174_S1	Our associates are citizens of many different countries and our operations are subject to the laws of many countries, provinces, states, and municipalities.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P174_S2	There may be a conflict between the applicable laws.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P174_S3	If you encounter such a conflict, you must immediately consult with Garmin's Legal Department to understand how to properly resolve that conflict.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P175_S0	The toll-free numbers for our Compliance Hotline are as follows:
1121788_11_ITEM15_P176_S0	Garmin requires all associates to review and understand the Code.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P176_S1	Once each year, Garmin will send you an electronic copy of the Code (which may be updated and supplemented by the company from time to time) and an annual acknowledgement form.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P176_S2	As a condition of your employment, you must acknowledge that you received a copy of the Code of Conduct and that you have read it and understand its rules.
1121788_11_ITEM15_P176_S3	New associates will sign an acknowledgement when they start working for Garmin.
