1121788_13_ITEM1A_P101_S1	Accordingly, these shareholders may be able to determine the outcome of corporate actions requiring shareholder approval, such as mergers and acquisitions.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P101_S2	This level of ownership may have a significant effect in delaying, deferring or preventing a change in control of Garmin and may adversely affect the voting and other rights of other holders of our common shares.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P102_S0	The rights of our shareholders are governed by Swiss law.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P103_S0	The rights of our shareholders are governed by Swiss law and Garmin Ltd. s articles of association and organizational regulations.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P103_S1	The rights of shareholders under Swiss law differ from the rights of shareholders of companies incorporated in other jurisdictions.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P103_S2	For example, Swiss law allows our shareholders acting at a shareholders meeting to authorize share capital that can be issued by the board of directors without approval of a shareholders meeting, but this authorization is limited to 50% of the existing registered share capital and must be renewed at a shareholders meeting at least every two years for it to continue to be available.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P103_S3	Additionally, subject to specified exceptions, including the exceptions described in our articles of association, Swiss law grants preemptive rights to existing shareholders to subscribe for new issuances of shares and other securities.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P103_S4	Swiss law also does not provide as much flexibility in the various terms that can attach to different classes of shares as the laws of some other jurisdictions.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P103_S5	Swiss law also reserves for approval by shareholders certain corporate actions over which a board of directors would have authority in some other jurisdictions.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P103_S6	For example, Swiss law provides that dividends and other distributions must be approved by shareholders at the general meeting of shareholders.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P103_S7	These Swiss law requirements relating to our capital management may limit our flexibility, and situations may arise where greater flexibility would have provided substantial benefits to our shareholders.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P104_S0	We may not be able to make distributions or repurchase shares without subjecting you to Swiss withholding tax.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P105_S0	If we are unable to make distributions, if any, through a reduction of par value or to pay dividends, if any, out of qualifying capital contribution reserves, then any dividends paid by us will generally be subject to a Swiss federal withholding tax at a rate of 35%.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P105_S1	The withholding tax must be withheld from the gross distribution and paid to the Swiss Federal Tax Administration.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P105_S2	A U.S. holder that qualifies for benefits under the Convention between the United States of America and the Swiss Confederation for the Avoidance of Double Taxation with Respect to Taxes on Income may apply for a refund of the tax withheld in excess of the 15% treaty rate (or in excess of the 5% reduced treaty rate for qualifying corporate shareholders with at least 10% participation in our voting stock, or for a full refund in case of qualified pension funds).
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P105_S3	Payment of a capital distribution in the form of a par value reduction or a dividend out of qualifying capital contribution reserves is not subject to Swiss withholding tax.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P105_S4	However, there can be no assurance that our shareholders will approve a reduction in par value or a dividend out of qualifying capital contribution reserves, that we will be able to meet the other legal requirements for a reduction in par value, or that Swiss withholding rules will not be changed in the future or that a change in Swiss law will not adversely affect us or our shareholders, in particular as a result of distributions out of qualifying capital contribution reserves becoming subject to additional corporate law or other restrictions.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P106_S0	There are currently legislative projects pending in Swiss Parliament and the Swiss federal administration that depending on their final form may limit the distribution of qualifying capital contribution reserves.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P106_S1	In addition, over the long term, the amount of par value and qualifying capital contribution reserves available for us to use for par value reductions or dividends will be limited.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P106_S2	If we are unable to make a distribution through a reduction in par value or to pay a dividend out of qualifying capital contribution reserves, we may not be able to make distributions without subjecting you to Swiss withholding taxes.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P107_S0	Under current Swiss tax law, repurchases of shares for the purposes of capital reduction are treated as a partial liquidation subject to 35% Swiss withholding tax on the difference between the par value and the repurchase price.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P107_S1	However, the portion of the repurchase price that is attributed to qualifying capital contribution reserves of the shares repurchased will not be subject to the Swiss withholding tax.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P107_S2	No partial liquidation treatment applies and no withholding tax is triggered if the shares are not repurchased for cancellation but held by us as treasury shares.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P107_S3	However, should we not resell such treasury shares within six years, the withholding tax becomes due at the end of the six year period.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P108_S0	We may follow a share repurchase process for future share repurchases, if any, similar to a second trading line on the SIX Swiss Exchange in which Swiss institutional investors buy shares on the open market and sell these shares to us and are generally able to receive a refund of the Swiss withholding tax.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P108_S1	However, if we are unable to use this process successfully, we may not be able to repurchase shares for the purposes of capital reduction without subjecting you to Swiss withholding taxes if and to the extent that the repurchase of shares is made out of retained earnings or other taxable reserves.
1121788_13_ITEM1A_P108_S2	No withholding tax would be applicable if and to the extent that qualifying capital contribution reserves are attributable to the share repurchase.
1121788_13_ITEM2_P0_S0	The following are the principal properties owned or leased by the Company and its subsidiaries:
1121788_13_ITEM2_P1_S0	Garmin International, Inc. and Garmin USA, Inc. occupy a facility of approximately 1,120,000 square feet on 42 acres in Olathe, Kansas, where the majority of product design and development work is conducted, the majority of aviation panel-mount products are manufactured and products are warehoused, distributed, and supported for North, Central and South America.
1121788_13_ITEM2_P1_S1	Garmin s subsidiary, Garmin Realty, LLC also owns an additional 46 acres of land on the Olathe site for future expansion.
1121788_13_ITEM2_P1_S2	In connection with the bond financings for the facility in Olathe and the previous expansion of that facility, the City of Olathe holds the legal title to the Olathe facility which is leased to Garmin s subsidiaries by the City.
1121788_13_ITEM2_P1_S3	Upon the payment in full of the outstanding bonds, the City of Olathe is obligated to transfer title to Garmin s subsidiaries for the aggregate sum of $200.
1121788_13_ITEM2_P1_S4	Garmin International, Inc. has purchased all the outstanding bonds and continues to hold the bonds until maturity in order to benefit from property tax abatement.
1121788_13_ITEM2_P2_S0	Garmin Corporation owns and occupies a 249,326 square foot facility in Sijhih, Taipei County, Taiwan, a 223,469 square foot facility in Jhongli, Tao-Yang County, Taiwan, and an approximately 580,000 square foot facility in LinKou, Tao-Yang County, Taiwan.
1121788_13_ITEM2_P2_S1	In these three facilities, Garmin Corporation manufactures all of Garmin s consumer and portable aviation products and warehouses, markets and supports products for the Pacific Rim countries.
1121788_13_ITEM2_P3_S0	Garmin AT, Inc. leases approximately 15 acres of land in Salem, Oregon under a ground lease.
1121788_13_ITEM2_P3_S1	This ground lease expires in 2030, but Garmin AT has the option to extend the ground lease until 2050.
1121788_13_ITEM2_P4_S0	Garmin AT, Inc. owns and occupies an 115,000 square foot facility for office, development and manufacturing use and a 33,000 square foot aircraft hangar, flight test and certification facility on this land.
1121788_13_ITEM2_P4_S1	Garmin AT, Inc. also leases 43,870 square feet of office space in a separate Salem, OR building for Garmin s newly-opened West Coast customer support call center.
1121788_13_ITEM2_P5_S0	Garmin International, Inc. leases 148,320 square feet of land at New Century Airport in Gardner, Kansas under a ground lease which expires in 2026.
1121788_13_ITEM2_P5_S1	Garmin International, Inc. owns and occupies a 47,254 square foot aircraft hangar, flight test and certification facility on this land which is used in development and certification of aviation products.
1121788_13_ITEM2_P5_S2	Garmin International, Inc. owns a leasehold interest in an additional 52,794 square foot aircraft hangar, flight test and certification facility at New Century Airport in Gardner which is also used in development and certification of aviation products.
1121788_13_ITEM2_P6_S0	Garmin W rzburg GmbH leases approximately 40,000 square feet in W rzburg, Germany for office and research and development activities.
1121788_13_ITEM2_P6_S1	Garmin Cluj S.R.L. leases approximately 11,355 square feet in Cluj, Romania for research and development activities.
1121788_13_ITEM2_P7_S0	Various Garmin subsidiaries lease an additional: (i) 48,625 square feet of office space in Olathe, Kansas for a call center operation; (ii) 24,748 square feet of aggregate office space in two buildings in Tempe, Arizona for software development; and (iii) 33,120 square feet of office space in two buildings in Tucson, Arizona, used as offices and a product production, repair and shipping facility.
1121788_13_ITEM2_P8_S0	Garmin (Europe) Ltd. owns and occupies a 155,000 square foot building located in Totton, Southampton, England, used as offices and a distribution facility.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P0_S0	Ambato Media, LLC v. Clarion Co., Ltd., Clarion Corporation of America, Delphi Corporation, Fujitsu Limited, Fujitsu Ten Corporation of America, Garmin Ltd., Garmin International, Inc., Victor Company of Japan Ltd., JVC Americas Corporation, JVC Kenwood Holdings, Inc., J K Car Electronics Corporation, LG Electronics, Inc., LG Electronics USA, Inc., MiTAC International Corporation, MiTAC Digital Corporation, Mio Technology USA Ltd., Navigon, Inc. Nextar Inc.,Panasonic Corporation, Panasonic Corporation of North America, Pioneer Corporation, Pioneer Electronics (USA) Inc.,Sanyo Electric Co., Ltd., Sanyo North America Corporation, Sanyo Electronic Device (U.S.A.) Corporation,TomTom N.V., TomTom International B.V., and TomTom, Inc.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P1_S0	On August 14, 2009, Ambato Media, LLC ( Ambato ) filed suit in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Texas against Garmin Ltd. and Garmin International, Inc. along with several codefendants alleging infringement of U.S. Patent No. 5,432,542 ( the 542 patent ).
1121788_13_ITEM3_P1_S1	On September 28, 2009, Garmin filed its answer and counterclaims asserting that each asserted claim of the 542 patent is invalid and/or not infringed.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P1_S2	Following a trial, the jury issued a verdict on July 18, 2012 finding that the 542 patent was infringed and awarding damages of $500,000 to Ambato.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P1_S3	On September 18, 2012, the court awarded Ambato $133,950 in pre-judgment interest.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P2_S0	On September 28, 2012 Garmin filed a motion for judgment to be entered for Garmin as a matter of law.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P2_S1	On November 16, 2012, the Court dismissed the litigation following settlement between Garmin and Ambato.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P3_S0	Avocet Sports Technology, Inc. v. Garmin International, Inc., Implus Footcare, LLC d/b/a Highgear, Polar Electro, Inc., Brunton d/b/a Brunton Outdoor Group, and Casio America, Inc.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P4_S0	On August 18, 2011, Avocet Sports Technology, Inc. ( Avocet ) filed suit in the United States District Court for the Northern District of California against five companies, including Garmin International, Inc., alleging infringement of U.S. Patent No. 5,058,427 ( the 427 patent ).
1121788_13_ITEM3_P4_S1	On November 16, 2011, Garmin filed its answer asserting that each asserted claim of the 427 patent is not infringed and/or invalid.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P4_S2	On November 16, 2011, Garmin filed a motion to dismiss this lawsuit for failure to state a claim on which relief can be granted.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P4_S3	On March 22, 2012, this lawsuit was dismissed without prejudice by the court.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P4_S4	On April 16, 2012 Avocet re-filed the lawsuit.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P4_S5	On January 3, 2013, the Court dismissed the litigation following settlement between Garmin and Avocet.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P5_S0	Bandspeed, Inc. v. Acer, Inc., Acer American Corporation, Belkin International, Inc., Belkin,Inc., Casio Computer Co., Ltd., Xasio Hitachi Mobile CommunicationsCo. Ltd., Xasio America, Inc., Dell Inc., Garmin International, Inc., Garmin USA, Inc., GN Netcom A/S, GN U.S. Inc.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P5_S1	a/k/a GN Netcom Inc., Hewlett-Packard Company, Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P., HTC Corporation, HTC America, Inc., Huawei Technologies Co. Ltd., Kyocera Corporation, Kyocera International, Inc., Kyocera Communications, Inc., Kyocera Wireless Corporation, Lenovo (United States), Inc., LG Electronics, Inc., LG Electronics U.S.A. Inc., LG Electronics Mobilecomm U.S.A. Inc., Motorola, Inc., Nokia Corporation, Nokia Inc., Pantech Wireless, Inc.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P5_S2	Plantronics, inc., Research in Motion Ltd., Research in Motion Corporation, Samsung Telecommunications America, LLC, TomTom International B.V., TomTom, Inc., Toshiba Corporation, Toshiba America information Systems, Inc., and Toshiba America, Inc.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P6_S0	No 7,027,418 ( the 418 patent ) and U.S. Patent No 7,670,614 ( the 614 patent ).
1121788_13_ITEM3_P6_S1	On January 21, 2011, Bandspeed, Inc. filed an amended complaint adding additional claims against several of the codefendants, but not against Garmin.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P6_S2	On February 22, 2011, Garmin filed its answer to the amended complaint with counterclaims asserting that the asserted claims of the 418 and 614 patents are invalid and not infringed.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P6_S3	On August 15, 2011, the court granted Garmin s motion to transfer venue and transferred the case to the Western District of Texas.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P6_S4	On December 23, 2011, Bandspeed, Inc. filed a second amended complaint adding additional claims against Garmin.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P6_S5	On January 24, 2012, Garmin filed a motion to dismiss these additional claims.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P6_S6	Although there can be no assurance that an unfavorable outcome of this litigation would not have a material adverse effect on our operating results, liquidity or financial position, Garmin believes the claims in this lawsuit are without merit and intends to vigorously defend this action.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P7_S0	Cuozzo Speed Technologies, LLC, v Garmin International Inc,.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P7_S1	Garmin USA, INC., and Chrysler Group LLC.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P8_S0	On June 19, 2012, Cuozzo Speed Technologies, LLC filed suit in the United States District Court for the District of New Jersey against Garmin International, Inc., Garmin USA, INC., (collectively Garmin ) and Chrysler Group LLC, alleging infringement of U.S. Patent No. 6,778,074.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P8_S1	On July 16, 2012, Garmin filed its answer asserting that each asserted claim of the patent-in-suit is invalid and/or not infringed.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P8_S2	On September 17, 2012 Garmin filed with the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office a petition for inter partes review of the 074 patent as being anticipated and obvious in view of the prior art.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P8_S3	On January 9, 2013, the Patent Office partially granted Garmin s petition and instituted review of certain claims of the 074 patent.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P9_S0	Data Carriers, LLC v. Garmin USA, Inc.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P10_S0	On March 16, 2012, Data Carriers, LLC filed suit in the United States District Court for the District of Delaware against Garmin USA, Inc. alleging infringement of U.S. Patent No. 5,388,198.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P10_S1	On April 10, 2012, Garmin filed a motion to dismiss this lawsuit for failure to state a claim on which relief can be granted .
1121788_13_ITEM3_P10_S2	A settlement has been agreed between Data Carriers, LLC and a group of defendants, including Garmin USA, Inc. Final execution of the agreement, and dismissal of the litigation, will occur once all defendants in the group have executed the settlement agreement.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P11_S0	ICON Health Fitness, Inc. v. Garmin Ltd., Garmin International, Inc., and Garmin USA, Inc.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P12_S0	On November 18, 2011, ICON Health Fitness, Inc. filed suit in the United States District Court for the District of Utah against Garmin Ltd., Garmin International, Inc., and Garmin USA, Inc. (collectively Garmin ), alleging infringement of U.S. Patent Nos. 7,789,800 and 6,701,271.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P12_S1	On June 25, 2012, Garmin filed its answer asserting that each asserted claim of the patents-in-suit is invalid and/or not infringed.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P12_S2	Although there can be no assurance that an unfavorable outcome of this litigation would not have a material adverse effect on our operating results, liquidity, or financial position, Garmin believes the claims in this lawsuit are without merit and intends to vigorously defend this action.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P13_S0	No. 7,602,858 ( the 858 patent ), and U.S. Patent No. 7,715,494 ( the 494 patent ).
1121788_13_ITEM3_P13_S1	Garmin s semiconductor chip suppliers are also named in the complaint and Garmin believes these suppliers have indemnification obligations to defend Garmin in this matter.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P14_S0	On February 1, 2011, Garmin filed its answer asserting that the asserted claims of the 405, 353, 109, 857, 858, and the 494 patents are invalid and/or not infringed.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P14_S1	On September 1, 2011, the Board of Patent Appeals and Interferences issued a decision following reexamination of the 109 patent affirming that all claims of the 109 patent are invalid.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P14_S2	The ITC s hearing was held on October 12-20, 2011.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P14_S3	On March 2, 2012 the Administrative Law Judge issued an initial determination finding no violation of Section 337.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P14_S4	On July 25, 2012, the ITC issued a final determination finding no violation of Section 337.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P14_S5	The ITC s final determination is subject to appeal by Rambus.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P14_S6	Although there can be no assurance that an unfavorable outcome of Rambus appeal would not have a material adverse effect on our operating results, liquidity or financial position, Garmin believes these claims are without merit and intends to vigorously defend any appeal.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P15_S0	On July 24, 2012, Technology Properties Limited LLC, Phoenix Digital Solutions LLC, and Patriot Scientific Corporation filed a complaint with the United States International Trade Commission against 24 companies, including Garmin Ltd., Garmin International, Inc., and Garmin USA, Inc. (collectively Garmin ) alleging a violation of Section 337 of the Tariff Act of 1930, as amended, through alleged infringement by Garmin and the other respondents of U.S. Patent No. 5,809,336.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P15_S1	On August 21, 2012 the ITC instituted an investigation under Section 337 of the Tariff Act pursuant to this complaint.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P15_S2	Although there can be no assurance that an unfavorable outcome of this litigation would not have a material adverse effect on our operating results, liquidity, or financial position, Garmin believes these claims are without merit and intends to vigorously defend this action.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P16_S0	Norman IP Holdings, LLC v. Lexmark International, Inc., Ricoh Americas Corporation, Belkin International, Inc., BMW of North America, LLC, Daimler North America Corporation, Mercedes - Benz USA, LLC, D - Link Systems, Inc., Dish Network Corporation, Ford Motor Company, Garmin International, Inc., Garmin USA, Inc., General Electric Company, General Motors Company, JVC Americas Corporation, Novatel Wireless, Inc., Novatel Wireless Solutions, Inc., Novatel Wireless Technology, Inc., TomTom, Inc., Viewsonic Corporation, Vizio, Inc., Volkswagen Group of America, Inc., Xerox Corporation, ZTE (USA) Inc., and ZTE Solutions Inc.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P17_S0	On January 27, 2012, Norman IP Holdings, LLC filed an amended complaint in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Texas naming 23 companies, including Garmin International, Inc. and Garmin USA, Inc. (collectively Garmin ) and alleging infringement of U.S. Patent Nos. 5,530,597, 5,502,689, 5,592,555, 5,608,873, and 5,771,394.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P17_S1	On February 27, 2012 Garmin filed a motion to dismiss this lawsuit or, alternatively, for severance due to misjoinder.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P17_S2	On August 10, 2012, Garmin s motion to sever was granted by the court but the litigation was consolidated for all pretrial issues with the original litigation.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P17_S3	Although there can be no assurance that an unfavorable outcome of this litigation would not have a material adverse effect on our operating results, liquidity, or financial position, Garmin believes the claims of this lawsuit are without merit and intends to vigorously defend this action.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P18_S0	Pacing Technologies, LLC v. Garmin International, Inc., Garmin USA, Inc. and Garmin Ltd.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P19_S0	On May 1, 2012, Pacing Technologies, LLC filed suit in the United States District Court for the Southern District of California against Garmin International, Inc., Garmin USA, Inc. and Garmin Ltd alleging infringement of U.S. Patent No. 8,101,843.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P19_S1	On July 6, 2012, Garmin filed its answer asserting that each asserted claim of the patent-in-suit is invalid and/or not infringed.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P19_S2	Although there can be no assurance that an unfavorable outcome of this litigation would not have a material adverse effect on our operating results, liquidity, or financial position, Garmin believes the claims in this lawsuit are without merit and intends to vigorously defend this action.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P20_S0	Silver State Intellectual Technologies, Inc. v. Garmin International, Inc. and Garmin USA, Inc.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P21_S0	On September 29, 2011, Silver State Intellectual Technologies, Inc. filed suit in the United States District Court for the District of Nevada against Garmin International, Inc. and Garmin USA, Inc. (collectively Garmin ), alleging infringement of U.S. Patent Nos. 6,525,768; 6,529,824; 6,542,812; 7,343,165; 7,522,992; 7,593,812; 7,650,234; 7,702,455 and 7,739,039.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P21_S1	On December 8, 2011, Garmin filed its answer asserting that each asserted claim of the patents-in-suit is invalid and/or not infringed.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P21_S2	Although there can be no assurance that an unfavorable outcome of this litigation would not have a material adverse effect on our operating results, liquidity, or financial position, Garmin believes the claims in this lawsuit are without merit and intends to vigorously defend this action.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P22_S0	Taranis IP LLC v. Garmin International, Inc., Universal Avionics Systems Corporation, Johnson Outdoors Marine Electronics, Inc., Johnson Outdoors Inc., Raymarine Inc., Raymarine UK Ltd., Navico, Inc., and Navico Holdings A.S.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P23_S0	On November 22, 2010, Taranis IP LLC filed suit in the United States District Court for the Northern District of Illinois against eight companies, including Garmin International, Inc., alleging infringement of U.S. Patent No. 5,995,903 ( the 903 patent ).
1121788_13_ITEM3_P23_S1	On February 1, 2011, Garmin filed its answer and counterclaims asserting that each asserted claim of the 903 patent is invalid and/or not infringed.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P23_S2	On August 31, 2011, the court granted Garmin s motion and stayed this case pending the conclusion of the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office s reexamination of the 903 patent.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P24_S0	On June 29, 2012, the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office issued a second rejection of certain claims of the 903 patent.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P24_S1	On September 13, 2012, the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office issued a final rejection of the reviewed claims of the 903 patent.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P24_S2	On November 16, 2012, the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office allowed the reviewed claims after amendment by Taranis.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P24_S3	Although there can be no assurance that an unfavorable outcome of this litigation would not have a material adverse effect on our operating results, liquidity, or financial position, Garmin believes the claims in this lawsuit are without merit and intends to vigorously defend this action.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P25_S0	Technology Properties Limited, LLC et al v. Garmin Ltd., Garmin International, Inc. and Garmin USA, Inc.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P26_S0	On July 24, 2012 Technology Properties Limited LLC, Phoenix Digital Solutions LLC, and Patriot Scientific Corporation filed suit in the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of California against Garmin Ltd., Garmin International, Inc., and Garmin USA, Inc. (collectively Garmin ) alleging infringement by Garmin of one or more of the following patents: U.S. Patent No. 5,809,336, U.S. Patent 5,440,749 and U.S. Patent No. 5,530,890.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P26_S1	By agreement of the parties, on October 29, 2012 this lawsuit was stayed pending the resolution of the investigation by the International Trade Commission in In the Matter of Certain Wireless Consumer Electronics Devices and Components Thereof which is described above.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P26_S2	Although there can be no assurance that an unfavorable outcome of this litigation would not have a material adverse effect on our operating results, liquidity, or financial position, Garmin believes the claims in this action are without merit and intends to vigorously defend this action.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P27_S0	Triangle Software, LLC v. Garmin International, Inc., TomTom Inc., Volkswagen Group of America, Inc. and Westwood One, Inc.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P28_S0	On December 28, 2010, Triangle Software, LLC filed suit in the United States District Court for the Eastern District of Virginia against four companies, including Garmin International, Inc., alleging infringement of U.S. Patent No. 7,557,730 ( the 730 patent ), U.S. Patent No. 7,221,287 ( the 287 patent ), U.S. Patent No. 7,375,649 ( the 649 patent ), U.S. Patent No. 7,508,321 ( the 321 patent ), and U.S. Patent No. 7,702,452 ( the 452 patent ).
1121788_13_ITEM3_P28_S1	On March 16, 2011, Garmin filed its amended answer asserting that the patents-in-suit are unenforceable because of the inequitable conduct committed by the inventors before the Patent Office and filed counterclaims asserting that each asserted claim of the 730, 287, 649, 321, and 452 patents is not infringed and/or invalid.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P28_S2	On July 27, 2011, the court issued its claim construction order.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P28_S3	Trial was held beginning on November 1, 2011.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P28_S4	On November 9, 2011, the jury returned a partial verdict finding the patents-in-suit were valid and finding the 730, 287, and 321 patents were not infringed.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P28_S5	The jury did not return a verdict regarding infringement of the 649 and 452 patents.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P28_S6	On November 23, 2011, the parties filed motions with the court to resolve the remaining issues left unresolved by the jury s partial verdict.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P28_S7	On February 16, 2012, the court issued an order entering the jury s verdict of non-infringement of the 730, 287, and 321 patents, granting Garmin s motion for summary judgment of non-infringement of the 649 and 452 patents, and dismissing the case.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P29_S0	On March 13, 2012 Triangle Software filed a motion to alter or amend judgment and a motion for a new trial.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P29_S1	These motions were denied by the District Court on April 2, 2012.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P30_S0	Triangle filed an appeal to the United States Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P30_S1	On February 12, 2013, the United States Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit denied Triangle s appeal and affirmed the District Court s judgment in favor of Garmin.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P31_S0	Visteon Global Technologies, Inc. and Visteon Technologies LLC v. Garmin International, Inc.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P32_S0	No 6,097,316 ( the 316 patent ).
1121788_13_ITEM3_P33_S0	On May 17, 2010, Garmin filed its answer asserting that each claim of the 060 patent, the 892 patent, the 408 patent and the 375 patent is invalid and/or not infringed.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P34_S0	On April 12, 2011, the special master appointed by the court held a claim construction hearing.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P34_S1	On December 12, 2011, the court issued an order adopting the special master s report construing the claims of the patents-in-suit.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P35_S0	On September 14, 2012, Garmin filed with the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office petitions for ex parte reexamination of the 408 patent and the 060 patent as being anticipated and obvious in view of the prior art.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P35_S1	The U.S. Patent and Trademark Office subsequently granted Garmin s requests for ex parte reexaminations and initially rejected all identified claims.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P35_S2	On November 30, 2012, Garmin filed motions for summary judgment of non-infringement and /or invalidity for the 892, 316, and 375 patents.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P35_S3	Visteon filed its own motions for summary judgment of infringement of the 408 patent and validity, under section 112, of the 375 and 060 patents.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P35_S4	On February 4, 2013, the summary judgment motions were referred to the special master for consideration.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P36_S0	Although there can be no assurance that an unfavorable outcome of this litigation would not have a material adverse effect on our operating results, liquidity or financial position, Garmin believes that the claims in this lawsuit are without merit and intends to vigorously defend this action.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P37_S0	In the normal course of business, the Company and its subsidiaries are parties to various legal claims, actions, and complaints, including matters involving patent infringement and other intellectual property claims and various other risks.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P37_S1	It is not possible to predict with certainty whether or not the Company and its subsidiaries will ultimately be successful in any of these legal matters, or if not, what the impact might be.
1121788_13_ITEM3_P37_S2	However, the Company s management does not expect that the results in any of these legal proceedings will have a material adverse effect on the Company s results of operations, financial position or cash flows.
1121788_13_ITEM4_P0_S0	Pursuant to General Instruction G(3) of Form 10-K and instruction 3 to paragraph (b) of Item 401 of Regulation S-K, the following list is included as an unnumbered Item in Part I of this Annual Report on Form 10-K in lieu of being included in the Company s Definitive Proxy Statement in connection with its annual meeting of shareholders scheduled for June 7, 2013.
1121788_13_ITEM4_P1_S0	Dr. Min H. Kao , age 64, has served as Executive Chairman of Garmin Ltd. since January 2013 and was previously Chairman of Garmin Ltd. from August 2004 to December 2012 and Co-Chairman of Garmin Ltd. from August 2000 to August 2004.
1121788_13_ITEM4_P1_S1	He served as Chief Executive Officer of Garmin Ltd. from August 2002 to December 2012 and previously served as Co-Chief Executive Officer from August 2000 to August 2002.
1121788_13_ITEM4_P1_S2	Dr. Kao served as a director and officer of various subsidiaries of the Company from August 1990 until January 2013.
1121788_13_ITEM4_P1_S3	Dr. Kao holds Ph.D. and MS degrees in Electrical Engineering from the University of Tennessee and a BS degree in Electrical Engineering from National Taiwan University.
1121788_13_ITEM4_P2_S0	Clifton A. Pemble , age 47, has served as a director of Garmin Ltd. since August 2004.
1121788_13_ITEM4_P2_S1	He has served as President and Chief Executive Officer of Garmin Ltd. since January 2013.
1121788_13_ITEM4_P2_S2	Previously, he served as President and Chief Operating Officer of Garmin Ltd. from October 2007 to December 2012.
1121788_13_ITEM4_P2_S3	Previously, he was Vice President, Engineering of Garmin International, Inc. from 2005 to October 2007, Director of Engineering of Garmin International, Inc. from 2003 to 2005, and Software Engineering Manager of Garmin International, Inc. from 1995 to 2002 and a Software Engineer with Garmin International, Inc. from 1989 to 1995.
1121788_13_ITEM4_P2_S4	Mr. Pemble has served as a director and officer of various Garmin subsidiaries since August 2003.
1121788_13_ITEM4_P2_S5	Mr. Pemble holds BA degrees in Mathematics and Computer Science from MidAmerica Nazarene University.
1121788_13_ITEM4_P3_S0	Kevin S. Rauckman , age 50, has served as Chief Financial Officer and Treasurer of Garmin Ltd. since August 2000.
1121788_13_ITEM4_P3_S1	He previously served as Director of Finance and Treasurer of Garmin International, Inc. since January 1999 and has served as a director and officer of various subsidiaries of the Company since April 2001.
1121788_13_ITEM4_P3_S2	Mr. Rauckman holds BS and MBA degrees in Business from the University of Kansas.

1121788_13_ITEM4_P4_S1	He was previously General Counsel and Secretary of Garmin Ltd. from August 2000 to June 2009.
1121788_13_ITEM4_P4_S2	He has been Vice President and General Counsel of Garmin International, Inc. since July 2007, General Counsel since February 1998, and Secretary since October 1998.
1121788_13_ITEM4_P4_S3	Mr. Etkind has served as a director and officer of various Garmin subsidiaries since December 2001.
1121788_13_ITEM4_P4_S4	Mr. Etkind holds BA, MA and LLM degrees from Cambridge University, England and a JD degree from the University of Michigan Law School.
1121788_13_ITEM4_P5_S0	All executive officers are elected by and serve at the discretion of the Company s Board of Directors.
1121788_13_ITEM4_P5_S1	None of the executive officers have an employment agreement with the Company.
1121788_13_ITEM4_P5_S2	There are no arrangements or understandings between the executive officers and any other person pursuant to which he or she was or is to be selected as an officer.
1121788_13_ITEM4_P5_S3	There is no family relationship among any of the executive officers.

1121788_13_ITEM5_P2_S0	On June 1, 2012 the shareholders approved a cash dividend in the amount of $1.80 per share out of Garmin s general reserves from capital contribution payable in four installments as follows: $0.45 on June 29, 2012 to shareholders of record on June 15, 2012, $0.45 on September 28, 2012 to shareholders of record on September 14, 2012, $0.45 on December 31, 2012 to shareholders of record on December 14, 2012 and $0.45 on March 29, 2013 to shareholders of record on March 15, 2013.
