1121788_17_ITEM8_P175_S0	As a result of Switzerland corporate tax reform failing to pass on February 12, 2017, coupled with potential tax risk from evolving global tax initiatives, the Company has elected on February 20, 2017 to adjust certain Switzerland tax positions.
1121788_17_ITEM8_P175_S1	The Company expects this election to result in an estimated 300 basis points increase to the fiscal year 2017 effective tax rate compared to fiscal year 2016.
1121788_17_ITEM8_P175_S2	In addition, the Company expects to revalue certain Switzerland deferred tax assets as a result of this election, for which the Company anticipates recording approximately $150 million of income tax benefit in the first quarter of 2017.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P0_S0	Under the supervision and with the participation of our management, including the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, we have evaluated the effectiveness of the design and operation of our disclosure controls and procedures pursuant to Exchange Act Rule 13a-15(b) as of the end of the period covered by this report.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P0_S1	Based on the evaluation, the Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer have concluded that these disclosure controls and procedures are effective.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P1_S0	Management of the Company is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting for the Company.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P1_S1	The Company s internal control over financial reporting is a process designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P2_S0	Because of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P2_S1	Also, projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to future periods are subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P3_S0	Management s assessment of and conclusion on the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting are included as Exhibits 31.1, 31.2, 32.1 and 32.2.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P4_S0	Management of the Company assessed the effectiveness of the Company s internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2016.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P4_S1	In making this assessment, management used the criteria set forth by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO) in Internal Control-Integrated Framework (2013 framework).
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P5_S0	Based on such assessment and those criteria, management believes that the Company maintained effective internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2016.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P6_S0	Ernst Young LLP, the independent registered public accounting firm that audited the Company s consolidated financial statements, issued an attestation report on management s effectiveness of the Company s internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2016, as stated in their report which is included herein.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P7_S0	We have audited Garmin Ltd. and Subsidiaries internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2016, based on criteria established in Internal Control Integrated Framework issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (2013 framework) (the COSO criteria).
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P7_S1	Garmin Ltd. and Subsidiaries management is responsible for maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting, and for its assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting included in the accompanying Management s Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P7_S2	Our responsibility is to express an opinion on the company s internal control over financial reporting based on our audit.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P8_S0	We conducted our audit in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States).
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P8_S1	Those standards require that we plan and perform the audit to obtain reasonable assurance about whether effective internal control over financial reporting was maintained in all material respects.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P8_S2	Our audit included obtaining an understanding of internal control over financial reporting, assessing the risk that a material weakness exists, testing and evaluating the design and operating effectiveness of internal control based on the assessed risk, and performing such other procedures as we considered necessary in the circumstances.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P8_S3	We believe that our audit provides a reasonable basis for our opinion.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P9_S0	A company s internal control over financial reporting is a process designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P9_S1	A company s internal control over financial reporting includes those policies and procedures that (1) pertain to the maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and dispositions of the assets of the company; (2) provide reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that receipts and expenditures of the company are being made only in accordance with authorizations of management and directors of the company; and (3) provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposition of the company s assets that could have a material effect on the financial statements.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P10_S0	Because of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P10_S1	Also, projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to future periods are subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P11_S0	In our opinion, Garmin Ltd. and Subsidiaries maintained, in all material respects, effective internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2016, based on the COSO criteria.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P12_S0	We also have audited, in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States), the consolidated balance sheets of Garmin Ltd. and Subsidiaries as of December 31, 2016 and December 26, 2015, and the related consolidated statements of income, comprehensive income, stockholders equity and cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December 31, 2016 of Garmin Ltd. and Subsidiaries and our report dated February 22, 2017 expressed an unqualified opinion thereon.
1121788_17_ITEM9A_P13_S0	There were no changes in our internal control over financial reporting during the quarter ended December 31, 2016 that have materially affected, or are reasonably likely to materially affect, our internal control over financial reporting.

1121788_17_ITEM12_P1_S0	The following table gives information as of December 31, 2016 about the Garmin common shares that may be issued under all of the Company s existing equity compensation plans, as adjusted for stock splits.
1121788_17_ITEM12_P2_S0	Table consists of the Garmin Ltd. 2005 Equity Incentive Plan (as Amended and Restated Effective June 5, 2010), the Garmin Ltd. 2000 Equity Incentive Plan, the Garmin Ltd.
1121788_17_ITEM12_P2_S1	Amended and Restated 2000 Non-Employee Directors Option Plan, effective June 5, 2010, the Garmin Ltd. Amended and Restated Employee Stock Purchase Plan, effective January 1, 2010 and the Garmin Ltd. 2011 Non-Employee Directors Equity Incentive Plan, effective June 3, 2011.
1121788_17_ITEM12_P3_S0	The weighted-average exercise price does not reflect the shares that will be issued upon the payment of outstanding awards of RSUs.
1121788_17_ITEM12_P4_S0	The Company has no knowledge of any arrangement, the operation of which may at a subsequent date result in a change in control of the Company.

1121788_18_ITEM1_P0_S0	This discussion of the business of Garmin Ltd. ( Garmin or the Company ) should be read in conjunction with, and is qualified by reference to, Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations under Item 7 herein and the information set forth in response to Item 101 of Regulation S-K in such Item 7 is incorporated herein by reference in partial response to this Item 1.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P1_S0	Garmin has identified five reportable segments for external reporting purposes: auto, aviation, marine, outdoor and fitness.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P1_S1	There are two operating segments (auto PND and auto OEM) that are not reported separately but are aggregated within the auto reportable segment.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P1_S2	Each operating segment is individually reviewed and evaluated by our Chief Operating Decision Maker (CODM), who allocates resources and assesses performance of each segment individually.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P1_S3	The segment and geographic information included in Item 8, Financial Statements and Supplementary Data, under Note 8 is incorporated herein by reference in partial response to this Item 1.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P2_S0	Garmin was incorporated in Switzerland on February 9, 2010 as successor to Garmin Ltd., a Cayman Islands company ( Garmin Cayman ).
1121788_18_ITEM1_P3_S0	Garmin Cayman was incorporated on July 24, 2000 as a holding company for Garmin Corporation, a Taiwan corporation, in order to facilitate a public offering of Garmin Cayman shares in the United States.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P3_S1	On June 27, 2010, Garmin became the ultimate parent holding company of the Garmin group of companies pursuant to a share exchange transaction effected for the purpose of changing the place of incorporation of the ultimate parent holding company of the Garmin group from the Cayman Islands to Switzerland (the Redomestication ).
1121788_18_ITEM1_P3_S2	Pursuant to the Redomestication, all issued and outstanding Garmin Cayman common shares were transferred to Garmin and each common share, par value U.S. $0.005 per share, of Garmin Cayman was exchanged for one registered share, par value 10 Swiss francs (CHF) per share, of Garmin.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P3_S3	At the Company s Annual General Meeting on June 10, 2016, the Company s shareholders approved the cancellation of 10,000,000 registered shares of the Company held by the Company (the Formation Shares ) and the reduction in par value of each share of the Company from CHF 10 to CHF 0.10 and the amendment of the Company s Articles of Association to effect a corresponding share capital reduction.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P3_S4	This share cancellation has reduced authorized shares from 208,077,418 shares to 198,077,418 shares, with an incremental 99,038,709 conditional shares that may be issued through the exercise of option rights, which are granted to Garmin employees or members of its Board of Directors.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P4_S0	Garmin owns, directly or indirectly, all of the operating companies in the Garmin group.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P5_S0	Garmin s annual report on Form 10-K, quarterly reports on Form 10-Q, current reports on Form 8-K, proxy statement and Forms 3, 4 and 5 filed by Garmin s directors and executive officers and all amendments to those reports will be made available free of charge through the Investor Relations section of Garmin s website (http://www.garmin.com) as soon as reasonably practicable after such material is electronically filed with, or furnished to, the Securities and Exchange Commission (the SEC ).
1121788_18_ITEM1_P5_S1	The SEC maintains a website (http://www.sec.gov) that contains reports, proxy and information statements, and other information regarding issuers that file electronically with the SEC.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P6_S0	The reference to Garmin s website address does not constitute incorporation by reference of the information contained on this website, and such information should not be considered part of this report on Form 10-K.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P7_S0	For over 25 years, Garmin Ltd. and subsidiaries (together, the Company ) has pioneered new Global Positioning System (GPS) navigation and wireless devices and applications that are designed for people who live an active lifestyle.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P8_S0	Garmin serves five primary business units, including auto, aviation, fitness, marine, and outdoor.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P8_S1	We believe it is through these business units that Garmin is able to achieve synergies in raw material purchases, manufacturing, distribution, research and development and marketing efforts making for a stronger, more effective company.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P9_S0	Garmin designs, develops, manufactures, markets and distributes a diverse family of hand-held, wearable, portable and fixed-mount GPS-enabled products and other navigation, communications, sensor-based and information products.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P9_S1	Since the inception of its business, Garmin has delivered over 188 million products, which includes the delivery of more than 15 million products during 2017.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P10_S0	The Global Positioning System is a worldwide navigation system which enables the precise determination of geographic location using established satellite technology.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P10_S1	The system consists of numerous constellations of orbiting satellites.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P10_S2	Access to the systems is provided free of charge.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P11_S0	Garmin utilizes a variety of global navigation satellite systems (GNSS) including, but not limited to:
1121788_18_ITEM1_P12_S0	The satellites and their ground control and monitoring stations maintained and operated by the United States Department of Defense, which maintains an ongoing satellite replenishment program to ensure continuous global system coverage.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P13_S0	Japan s MTSAT-based Satellite Augmentation System (MSAS) which achieved initial operating capability for enroute, terminal and approach navigation for aviation on September 27, 2007.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P14_S0	The European Geostationary Navigation Overlay Service (EGNOS) aviation Safety of Life (SoL) service which achieved initial operating capability for enroute, terminal, and approach navigation on March 2, 2011.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P15_S0	The Global Navigation Satellite System (GLONASS), a space-based satellite navigation system operated by the Russian Federation, consisting of 24 satellites and providing world-wide coverage.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P16_S0	The Galileo system, a global navigation satellite system that is currently being built by the European Union and European Space Agency with 30 total satellites planned for orbit (24 operational and six active spares), of which 14 are currently operational.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P16_S1	Complete operational status is expected by 2020.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P17_S0	In certain urban canyon or restricted sky visibility situations, the combination of GPS, GLONASS, and/or Galileo satellites to produce a navigation fix may result in improved accuracy.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P18_S0	On a subscription basis, certain Garmin products offer access to the Iridium satellite network, a synchronized constellation of 66 low Earth orbit (LEO) satellites offering global data communication coverage.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P18_S1	The Iridium network is the only network that spans the entire globe, offering 100 percent coverage worldwide to enable satellite-based communication.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P19_S0	The accuracy and utility of GPS can be enhanced through augmentation techniques which compute any remaining errors in the signal and broadcast these corrections to a GPS device.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P19_S1	The Federal Aviation Administration ( FAA ) has developed a Wide Area Augmentation System (WAAS) comprising ground reference stations and additional satellites that improve the accuracy of GPS positioning available in the United States and most of Canada and Mexico to approximately 3 meters.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P19_S2	WAAS supports the use of GPS as the primary means of enroute, terminal and approach navigation for aviation in the United States.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P19_S3	The increased accuracy offered by WAAS also enhances the utility of WAAS-enabled GPS receivers for consumer applications.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P20_S0	Garmin offers a broad range of solutions across its reportable segments as outlined below.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P21_S0	In general, Garmin believes that its products are known for their value, high performance, ease of use, innovation, and ergonomics.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P22_S0	Garmin offers a broad range of auto navigation products, as well as a variety of products and applications designed for the mobile GPS market.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P22_S1	Garmin currently offers to consumers around the world:
1121788_18_ITEM1_P23_S0	PNDs combine a full-featured GPS navigator (with built-in maps) with Garmin s uniquely simple user interface.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P23_S1	PNDs are sold under the Garmin Drive , z mo , d zl , RV and Garmin fleet product lines.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P24_S0	The z mo series offers motorcycle-specific features.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P24_S1	The RV series offers features specific to the RV enthusiast.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P24_S2	The d zl series offers over-the-road trucking features while the Garmin fleet series delivers an integrated tracking and dispatch fleet system.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P24_S3	Across the expansive product portfolio, Garmin offers features such as large screens, integrated traffic receivers for traffic avoidance, bundled lifetime map updates, spoken street names, voice activated navigation, speed limit indication, lane assist with PhotoReal junction views (thousands of high quality photos of actual upcoming junctions), Bluetooth hands-free capability, DashCams, driver awareness alerts, and backup cameras.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P25_S0	Garmin has cultivated key relationships with many OEMs, where we provide a host of solutions.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P25_S1	These range from complete embedded infotainment systems that provide a broad range of functionality, to integrated camera solutions, embedded navigation solutions, and precise positioning technology solutions.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P25_S2	These support not only the infotainment system in the vehicle, but also key advanced driver-assistance systems (ADAS) functionality as well.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P26_S0	Garmin offers mobile applications under the Garmin and NAVIGON product names.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P26_S1	The applications are offered across a broad range of smartphones and tablets including iOS, Android and Windows enabled devices.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P26_S2	These applications provide users turn-by-turn, voice-prompted directions and other advanced Garmin navigation features.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P26_S3	The Smartphone Link mobile application allows a compatible Garmin navigator to connect to a compatible smartphone.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P26_S4	Information can be shared between the smartphone and the navigator including notifications, contacts, search results, driving destination, and even parking location.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P26_S5	Additional Garmin Live Services can be accessed through Smartphone Link for useful, real-time driving information.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P27_S0	Garmin offers VIRB action cameras that capture 360-degree footage up to 5.7K/30fps with digital image stabilization, voice or wireless remote control, and the ability to take high quality still photographs while the video camera is recording.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P27_S1	VIRB action cameras offer built-in Wi-Fi, data sensors and a high-sensitivity GPS receiver to add speed, elevation, G-force, heart rate, and other data onto video through our VIRB Edit and VIRB Mobile applications.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P28_S0	Garmin offers a broad range of products designed for use in outdoor activities .
1121788_18_ITEM1_P28_S1	Garmin currently offers to consumers around the world:
1121788_18_ITEM1_P29_S0	Outdoor handhelds range from basic waypoints navigation capabilities to advanced color touchscreen devices offering barometric altimeter, 3-axis compass, camera, microSD card slot for optional customized maps, Bluetooth for smartphone connectivity, satellite communication and other features.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P29_S1	Outdoor handhelds are sold under the Oregon , Rino , Montana , eTrex , GPSMAP , Foretrex and inReach product lines.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P29_S2	Each series of products is designed to serve various price points and niche activity categories.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P30_S0	Handhelds with inReach include global satellite technology which, when combined with an active subscription, offers 2-way text messaging, S.O.S. capabilities and weather forecasts while anywhere in the world.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P31_S0	Garmin offers GPS ruggedized smartwatches for outdoor activity.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P32_S0	The f nix series provides advanced multisport features for hiking, climbing, skiing, running, cycling, swimming, yoga, and repetition counting.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P32_S1	The f nix series offers several different styling options, including premium jeweler s grade materials available in the f nix Chronos models.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P32_S2	The f nix 5, 5S, and 5X offer three different watch face sizes, along with multiple QuickFit band options available for each model.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P32_S3	The f nix series also offers a variety of navigational tools, third party application support with Connect IQ and connected features, as well as Elevate wrist heart rate technology for certain models.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P32_S4	The f nix 5X also includes full color mapping.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P33_S0	The tactix provides features inspired by the requirements of law enforcement and police special operations.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P33_S1	In 2017, Garmin also introduced the Descent Mk1, a watch style dive computer that offers divers GPS navigation, multiple dive modes, support for up to six gasses, and additional features including Garmin Elevate wrist heart rate technology and a variety of multisport features.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P34_S0	The Approach series of golf-focused devices includes both handhelds and wrist-worn products with over 41,000 preloaded worldwide golf courses.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P34_S1	The offerings range from basic display of yardages to the front, back and middle of greens to advanced, touchscreen devices providing measurement of individual shot distances and display of the slope-adjusted yardage to fairways, hazards and greens.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P35_S0	The S20 model is an entry level GPS golf watch that includes AutoShot to automatically record distance and location of shots, daily activity tracking and smart notifications.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P35_S1	The S60 model also includes a touchscreen display and PlaysLike feature, which takes into account the elevation change between golfers and their target to calculate the distance for how the shot will likely play.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P35_S2	T he X40 model also includes Garmin Elevate wrist-based heart rate monitoring .
1121788_18_ITEM1_P36_S0	A statistic-tracking feature allows users to track and analyze their golf statistics through Garmin Connect application.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P36_S1	Some devices include swing metrics, which give audible tones to fine-tune swing tempo, an internal compass which provides directional assistance to the pin on blind shots, manual pin positioning, which allows users to tap and drag the flag on the green for precise yardage to the flag, and the ability to display emails, text messages and alerts.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P37_S0	Garmin offers a series of dog-focused products providing a range of functionality including GPS-enabled dog tracking, electronic dog training, and electronic bark correction.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P37_S1	The products are offered under the Astro , Alpha , Atemos , PRO, Sport PRO , BarkLimiter , Delta and Delta Smart product lines.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P37_S2	The Astro series can pinpoint multiple dogs positions at one time through all-weather collars and a handheld system, and can also connect to a variety of compatible Garmin devices such as the Garmin DriveTrack 70 GPS navigator or certain f nix series watches to display dog positions .
1121788_18_ITEM1_P38_S0	Alpha combines the tracking capabilities of Astro with electronic dog training.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P39_S0	The BarkLimiter is an intuitive electronic bark correction device.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P39_S1	The Delta and PRO series of training collars offers a remote training device with integrated bark limiting capability for consumer and professional dog training markets.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P39_S2	Delta Smart is a dog training device and activity tracker that connects to the Garmin CANINE smartphone app, enabling pet owners to monitor their dog s activity and behavior directly from their smartphone, and give highly customized, or automated training corrections.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P40_S0	Garmin offers a broad range of products designed for use in fitness and activity tracking .
1121788_18_ITEM1_P40_S1	Garmin currently offers to consumers around the world:
1121788_18_ITEM1_P41_S0	The Forerunner series offers compact, lightweight training watches for athletes with an integrated GPS sensor that provide time, speed, distance, pace and other data.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P41_S1	Most models also offer a heart rate monitoring function and heart-rate based calorie computation.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P41_S2	In 2017, Garmin added the Forerunner 935, delivering a premium running and multisport watch with Garmin Elevate wrist-based heart rate monitoring.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P41_S3	All Forerunner models allow runners to upload their data to the Garmin Connect application , where they can store, analyze and share their workout data.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P41_S4	Additional advanced features include: Virtual Racer , which allows runners to race against their previous best times, recovery advisor, race predictor and VO2 max estimate.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P41_S5	Some models are designed specifically for triathletes.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P42_S0	These all-in-one GPS-enabled devices provide detailed swim metrics and track distance, speed/pace, elevation and heart rate for running and cycling.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P43_S0	The Edge series measures speed, distance, time, calories burned, climb and descent, and altitude offering an integrated personal training system designed for cyclists.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P43_S1	In addition, Garmin offers devices geared toward performance-driven cyclists offering real-time connectivity through a smartphone, providing live tracking, social media sharing and real-time weather updates.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P43_S2	In 2017, Garmin introduced the Edge 1030, a top-of-the-line bike computer with advanced navigation, performance and cycling awareness features.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P44_S0	Garmin offers Vector , which is a high-precision pedal-based power meter designed specifically for cyclists.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P44_S1	It provides power data to compatible devices with (or using) ANT+ technology.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P44_S2	Some models also measure and present right and left leg power balance.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P45_S0	Garmin offers the Varia product line focused on cycling safety and awareness.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P45_S1	Varia bike radar alerts cyclists when vehicles are approaching from behind and Varia bike lights make the cyclist more visible when out on the road.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P46_S0	Varia Vision is a heads up display that makes data available to the cyclist in their line of sight.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P47_S0	Garmin offers numerous devices to address the activity tracking market.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P47_S1	The v vofit fitness bands provide a personalized daily goal, track progress and remind users when it s time to move.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P47_S2	The devices feature a one-year battery life with an always-on display that show steps, goal countdown, calories, distance, time of day and heart rate when paired with a monitor.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P47_S3	The v vosmart provides the same functions as the v vofit bands but also includes Garmin Elevate , smart notifications and a vibration alert.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P47_S4	The v vosport also incorporates GPS, allowing users to even more accurately track distance, time and pace for their activities, as well as view a map of their activity on Garmin Connect .
1121788_18_ITEM1_P48_S0	The v voactive smartwatches are focused on the active lifestyle consumer with all the basic activity tracking features along with applications designed for running, cycling and swimming and includes connectivity to the Connect IQ application store for further customizations and capabilities.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P48_S1	Garmin Pay TM contactless payments was added with the launch of v voactive 3 in 2017.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P48_S2	The remainder of the vivo product line was updated in 2017 with the introduction of v vosmart 3, v vomove HR, v vosport, and v vofit 4 .
1121788_18_ITEM1_P49_S0	Garmin Connect and Garmin Connect Mobile are web and mobile platforms where users can track and analyze their fitness and wellness data.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P49_S1	In addition, users can share their accomplishments, create training groups and group challenges, and get feedback and encouragement from the Connect community.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P50_S0	The Connect IQ application development platform enables third-parties to create a variety of experiences that run on a wide assortment of Garmin devices.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P50_S1	Connect IQ provides developers with an easy-to-use software development kit (SDK) to facilitate development efforts in creating watch faces, applications, widgets, and data fields.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P50_S2	These third-party applications are available for download by Garmin users via their mobile phone or computer and run on their compatible Garmin wearable, bike computer, or outdoor handheld.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P51_S0	Garmin is a leading manufacturer of recreational marine electronics and offers a broad range of products.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P51_S1	Garmin currently offers to consumers around the world:
1121788_18_ITEM1_P52_S0	Garmin offers numerous chartplotters/MFDs under the GPSMAP and echoMAP product lines.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P52_S1	The offerings range from 4-inch portable and fix-mounted products to 24-inch fully-integrated Glass Helm offerings.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P53_S0	The Garmin Quickdraw Contours feature allows users the ability to generate their own fishing charts while they cruise around the lake.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P53_S1	Additional advanced features and connectivity available include smartphone applications that wirelessly send weather data to your plotter and remotely access your helm electronics.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P53_S2	Additionally, most models have the CHIRP sonar function fully integrated to reduce system cost.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P53_S3	Our chartplotters also support plug-and-play access to onboard sensors and Garmin accessories with NMEA 2000, Garmin Marine Network (a system that combines GPS, radar, SiriusXM WX Satellite Weather, sonar, and other components) and the FUSION-Link entertainment interface.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P53_S4	Most of our chartplotter/MFD line-up also support Wi-Fi to enable many connected features including mobile updates and data synchronization to ensure the latest information and software is always available for the vessel.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P53_S5	The ActiveCaptain app (available in the Apple and Android app stores) enables the full set of connected features through mobile phones or tablets.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P54_S0	Garmin is a premier supplier of cartography for the recreational marine electronics market.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P54_S1	In 2017 we acquired Navionics, which complements the BlueChart g2 and LakeV HD cartography we already offered.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P54_S2	Navionics cartography is also compatible with 3 rd party chart plotters as well, and the combination makes Garmin the worldwide leader in recreational marine content.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P54_S3	Cartography options range from U.S. coastal and inland lake mapping, including worldwide basemaps, to highly detailed BlueChart g2 Vision and LakeV HD Ultra charts with coverage in many parts of the world offering auto-guidance (Garmin US-patented), 3-D chart views and aerial reference photos.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P54_S4	BlueChart g2 Vision and LakeV HD Ultra include Garmin s most detailed cartography created based on surveys done in U.S. inland waters by Garmin s fleet of high tech boats.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P54_S5	Under the Navionics brand, we offer Navionics+ Marine Lakes as well as Navionics Platinum with premium features such as satellite overlay and 3D charts.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P54_S6	We also offer the highly-rated Navionics boating app to bring cartography to mobile phones and tablets of boaters worldwide.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P55_S0	Garmin offers a new advanced line of fishfinders, the Striker series, which incorporate GPS technology and Quickdraw Contours .
1121788_18_ITEM1_P55_S1	These fishfinders are available in screen sizes from 4 to 9 inches and are paired with our latest technology sonar transducers to provide the clearest sonar pictures on the water.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P55_S2	ClearV sonar and Quickdraw Contours are offered on the 4-, 5-, 7- and 9-inch models which provides high resolution images of what is under the boat and the ability to create your own fishing maps.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P55_S3	The 7- and 9-inch models also offer a SideV option which provides similar high resolution images but reaches much further out on either side of the boat making the search for fish more efficient.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P55_S4	The GPS technology enables anglers to have highly accurate speed information and mark their best fishing spots and then easily return to them next weekend, next month, or next year.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P55_S5	The 7- and 9-inch models also offer Wi-Fi technology which enables wireless updates and Quickdraw Contour sharing that give anglers the ability to share their fishing maps with others or download maps from a community where others have shared their maps.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P56_S0	Garmin offers black-box sounders and smart transducers which interface with Garmin MFDs to enhance their utility by providing the depth sounder and fish finder functions in a remote mounted package.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P56_S1	The black boxes provide CHIRP, ClearV , and SideV sonar similar to our integrated sonar plotters, but can be mounted in a more convenient location away from the helm.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P56_S2	Additionally, we offer up to 3kW transmit power with our black box line-up which will reach deeper depths for ocean use.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P56_S3	Our newest smart transducer line is the Panoptix all seeing sonar .
1121788_18_ITEM1_P56_S4	It uses new technology to provide detailed images that can be seen real-time (LiveV ) and in 3D (RealV ).
1121788_18_ITEM1_P56_S5	The Panoptix line also offers multiple forward-looking transducers for transom, trolling motor, or thru-hull mounting configurations that enable the FrontV feature.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P57_S0	FrontV allows mariners to see ahead of the boat a distance of 8 to 10 times the water depth up to 300 feet.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P58_S0	Garmin offers full-featured marine autopilot systems designed for sailboats and powerboats.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P58_S1	The systems incorporate such features as: Garmin s patented Shadow Drive technology, which automatically disengages the autopilot if the helm is turned, remote steering and speed control, and integration with the Volvo Penta IPS steering and propulsion system.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P58_S2	Garmin has also introduced steer-by-wire autopilot capabilities for various steering systems.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P59_S0	Garmin offers high-tech solid state Fantom radar with MotionScope Doppler technology, lowering system power consumption while greatly improving situational awareness of the captain.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P59_S1	MotionScope can instantly show if a target is closing in or safely going the other direction.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P60_S0	Fantom radars are available in both radomes and open array radar products with compatibility to any network-compatible Garmin chartplotter.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P60_S1	When paired with our newer MFDs, the radars support dual-range mode so users can operate the radar in two ranges independently.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P61_S0	The Fantom radars are offered in addition to the more traditional magnetron radars.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P61_S1	The Garmin radar solutions range from 18 inches to 6 feet antennas and from 4kW (or equivalent) up to 25kW with a maximum range of 96 nautical miles.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P62_S0	Garmin offers NMEA 2000 and NMEA 0183 compliant instrument displays that show data from multiple remote sensors on one screen.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P62_S1	Mariners can display instrument data such as depth, speed through the water, water temperature, fuel flow rate, engine data, fuel level, wind direction and more, depending upon the specific sensors connected.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P62_S2	Garmin instruments offer screen sizes from 4 to 10 inches, and the 10-inch mast mounted displays provide maximum visibility around the vessel.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P63_S0	Garmin provides marine radios with differing feature sets for the radio needs of all types of mariners.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P63_S1	The entry-level radio is NMEA 2000 compatible, while the mid-range and premium radios are designed for larger vessels and are NMEA 2000 and NMEA 0183 compatible, offer multi-station support, and monitor all AIS channels at the same time.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P63_S2	Some models offer an AIS receiver built-in to the standard VHF radio.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P64_S0	Garmin offers a m arine-friendly GPS handheld featuring a 3-axis tilt-compensated electronic compass, wireless data transfer between compatible units and preloaded cartography for the coastal United States.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P64_S1	The quatix series, Garmin GPS watches designed for mariners, combines marine features for navigation, sailing, stereo control, and even some autopilot functions while integrating Garmin s GPS technology and interface.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P64_S2	The quatix 5 model also includes Garmin Elevate wrist-based heart rate monitoring.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P65_S0	Garmin has integrated many basic and advanced sailing features into our MFD and instrument systems.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P65_S1	These SailAssist features include enhanced wind rose with true and apparent wind data, pre-race guidance, synchronized race timer, virtual starting line, time to burn and lay line data fields.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P66_S0	Garmin s entertainment brand, FUSION , consists of marine audio head units, speakers and amplifiers.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P66_S1	These products are designed specifically for the marine or RV environments and support many connectivity options for integrating with MFDs, smartphones, and even the Garmin quatix marine watch for an outstanding experience on the water.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P67_S0	The FUSION marine head units are designed specifically for the marine environment and feature up to 4 zones in one unit to control.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P67_S1	The system can support multiple head units allowing control of the whole system from a Garmin MFD.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P68_S0	Garmin s aviation segment is a leading provider of solutions to aircraft manufacturers, existing aircraft owners and operators, as well as military/government customers and serves a range of aircraft including business aviation, general aviation, experimental/light sport, helicopters, optionally piloted vehicles (OPV), unmanned aerial vehicles (UAV) and more.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P68_S1	Garmin s portfolio includes flight displays, navigation, communication, flight control, hazard avoidance, weather radar, radar altimeter, datalink weather receivers and services, engine information systems, traffic collision avoidance systems, terrain awareness and warning systems (TAWS), controller-pilot data link (CPDLC), an expansive suite of automatic dependent surveillance broadcast (ADS-B) solutions, in-cockpit and cloud connectivity, wearables, portables, apps, training, simulation, aviation data services as well as other solutions that are known for innovation, reliability, and value.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P68_S2	The list below includes a sampling of some of the aviation capabilities currently offered by Garmin around the world:
1121788_18_ITEM1_P69_S0	Garmin offers a range of integrated glass flight decks from the G1000 and G1000 NXi for the general aviation and business aviation markets to the G5000 for business aviation, military and commercial applications.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P69_S1	Integrated capabilities include: navigation, communication, flight instruments, weather, terrain, traffic, ADS-B, engine information on large high-resolution color displays, and automatic flight control systems.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P69_S2	Head-up display technology virtually mirrors the primary flight display instruments allowing for increased aircraft capability in adverse weather conditions.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P69_S3	Additional features include: Garmin s 3-D synthetic vision technology (SVT ), weather, Garmin s electronic stability and protection system (ESP ), electronic flight charts, touchscreen and voice controls, CPDLC, audio and visual feedback, and animation to help pilots know exactly how the system is responding to their input.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P70_S0	Garmin offers similar integrated glass flight decks for the helicopter market with the G1000H and G5000H .
1121788_18_ITEM1_P70_S1	Basic and advanced capabilities are similar to those offered to the aircraft market.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P70_S2	The helicopter offerings have been optimized for rotorcraft and offer features like helicopter synthetic vision technology (HSVT ), helicopter terrain awareness and warning system with voice call outs, radar altimeter display, helicopter-specific databases that include additional heliports and low-altitude obstacles, WireAware wire-strike avoidance technology, as well as high resolution terrain, tailored ADS-B traffic alerting, and the ability to display video from a forward looking infrared (FLIR) camera or other video sources.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P71_S0	Garmin also offers all-glass integrated flight decks to the retrofit market through G950 NXi, G1000 NXi and G5000 .
1121788_18_ITEM1_P71_S1	Additionally, Garmin offers electronic flight display solutions that provide essential information such as aircraft altitude, attitude and heading while also displaying data from other avionics such as weather, traffic and much more.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P71_S2	These solutions include G3X Touch , G500H, G500 TXi, G600 TXi and G700 TXi.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P72_S0	Garmin serves the market with the GTN series, a premium touchscreen GPS, VHF navigation and communication, and multi-function display (MFD).
1121788_18_ITEM1_P72_S1	In addition to these core functions, this series of products combines a wealth of information for the pilot into a single display including flight planning, datalink weather, weather radar, traffic, terrain awareness and warning system (TAWS/HTAWS), charts, airport information, airspace boundaries, and much more.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P72_S2	Additional capabilities provide advanced ADS-B In traffic display, including TerminalTraffic and patented TargetTrend technology as well as the ability to control the display with voice commands.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P72_S3	Advanced GTN integration capabilities provide the option to install and control a remotely located transponder and audio processor for an even more streamlined installation and single interface.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P72_S4	The GTN series also provides wireless cockpit connectivity (when properly equipped) with mobile device apps (such as Garmin Pilot ) or portable aviation navigators (such as aera 660).
1121788_18_ITEM1_P72_S5	Wireless cockpit connectivity features can include voice call control, text messaging, automatic wireless database updating via Database Concierge, wireless flight plan transfer, SiriusXM radio control, sharing of weather, traffic, position information and more.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P72_S6	Garmin also offers more traditional VHF navigation and VHF communication transceivers with the GNC and GTR series.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P73_S0	Garmin offers a comprehensive line of traffic alert and collision avoidance systems (TCAS) and traffic advisory systems (TAS) for all markets served.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P73_S1	Advanced TCAS II systems actively identify potential aircraft threats, coordinate and instruct the pilot with a resolution advisory (RA) via a spoken command.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P73_S2	The GTS series also offers TCAS I and TAS that combine active and passive surveillance data to pinpoint specific traffic threats.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P73_S3	The systems use our patented CLEAR CAS technology and correlate passive automatic dependent surveillance broadcast (ADS-B) targets with active surveillance targets for a more comprehensive display to the pilot .
1121788_18_ITEM1_P73_S4	These systems can also provide audible alerts in a spoken ATC-like format that is easily understood by the pilot and allows him to keep his eyes outside of the aircraft.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P74_S0	The GMA series of audio panels ranging from offerings with basic capabilities for the recreational pilot to advanced capabilities including voice control of audio panel and GTN series functions, Bluetooth connectivity for wireless music input, phone calls and VIRB action camera audio output, advanced audio effects, 3D spatial audio processing, digital voice recorder, advanced auto squelch, ambient noise based volume adjustment and independent pilot/co-pilot communications capabilities.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P74_S1	When connected to a Garmin GTN series navigator, advanced voice control functions are available, and include the ability to change page views, load destination frequencies and much more.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P75_S0	Garmin offers solutions for all aviation markets we serve that meet and exceed the FAA s ADS-B mandate that requires all aircraft operating in select U.S. airspace (typically where a Mode C or S transponder is required today) to equip by 2020.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P75_S1	For business aviation aircraft, Garmin pairs the GTX 3000 transponder and GDL 88 datalink for both ADS-B out and in while mitigating the need to modify the existing aircraft panel.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P75_S2	The GTX 345 and GTX 335 are also available as an option for some business aviation aircraft.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P76_S0	Business aviation, general aviation, helicopters and experimental/light sport aircraft can utilize our popular GTX 345 series of all-in-one ADS-B transponders that offer options with and without GPS built-in (if the aircraft is not already equipped with mandate required GPS source) as well as ADS-B In .
1121788_18_ITEM1_P76_S1	ADS-B In information can be displayed on compatible Garmin displays like G1000 , G1000 NXi, GTN , G500, G600, G500 TXi , G600 TXi, and G700 TXi, as well as select third party displays.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P76_S2	Additionally, the GTX 345 can wirelessly transmit this data to a portable device such as a tablet using the Garmin Pilot app or compatible Garmin portable.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P77_S0	In offers pilots basic weather information including weather radar imagery, as well as traffic information that can be enhanced with our TerminalTraffic and patented TargetTrend technology.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P78_S0	Garmin also offers a range of FAA certified UAT-based ADS-B products within the GDL series, including both ADS-B Out and ADS-B In/Out solutions with options for built-in GPS.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P79_S0	Many of the ADS-B In capable products provide traffic correlation with both Garmin and other compatible third party traffic systems (such as TCAS) to provide a single, correlated display of traffic to the pilot.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P79_S1	Some products also offer the option for diversity (dual) antenna installations.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P80_S0	Weather capabilities are delivered within our GDL , GSR , GSX , GTX and GWX series.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P80_S1	Garmin solutions include offering SiriusXM satellite data link weather information (subscription required) to an aircraft via various panel-mount Garmin displays and/or portable devices.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P80_S2	With our GSR 56 datalink, on-demand global weather information, text/voice communications and position tracking through the Iridium satellite network (subscription required) is available.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P81_S0	The GWX and GSX series offer solid state, real-time, airborne doppler-capable weather radar solutions.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P81_S1	Doppler-enhanced features include ground-clutter suppression and turbulence detection.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P81_S2	Advanced capabilities also include lightning and hail prediction, volumetric autoscanning and predictive windshear technology.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P82_S0	Garmin offers both standalone and integrated flight control solutions.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P82_S1	Our G1000 , G1000 NXi, G2000 , G3000 and G5000 platforms are integrated with our GFC 700 digital autopilot.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P82_S2	For aircraft not equipped with a Garmin integrated flight deck, we offer the GFC 600 and GFC 500 digital autopilots.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P82_S3	The GFC 600 and GFC 500 uniquely integrate with our other stand-alone avionics to allow display of the autopilot modes, flight director (FD) command cues and more.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P82_S4	The unique design of our autopilots delivers superior in-flight characteristics, self-monitoring capabilities and minimal maintenance needs when compared to older generation autopilot systems.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P82_S5	They also boast a robust feature set that incorporates a number of safety-enhancing technologies, including Electronic Stability and Protection (ESP ), underspeed/overspeed protection, Level Mode and much more.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P83_S0	Garmin offers a variety of portable aviation solutions, including our aera series portable navigators, VIRB aviation action cameras, D2 series pilot watches and GDL series remote ADS-B/SiriusXM receivers.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P83_S1	The aera series offers aviators a touchscreen navigation device compatible with a complement of aviation databases including navigation, SafeTaxi , FliteCharts , airport directory and terrain/obstacles for heightened situational awareness.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P83_S2	Advanced features can include: 3D Vision virtual perspective view of surrounding terrain, a digital document viewer, a scratch pad, geo-referenced sectional and approach charts, wireless database updating, and SiriusXM radio and weather display (subscription required).
1121788_18_ITEM1_P83_S3	Complementing the portable display products and the Garmin Pilot mobile application is the GDL 52 series, which can provide a remote source of GPS, ADS-B In information for traffic and weather, SiriusXM weather and audio as well as backup attitude reference.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P84_S0	The Garmin wearable aviation solutions include our D2 series pilot watches, which offer a built-in worldwide aviation navigation database and more alongside multisport and smartwatch features.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P84_S1	Designed specifically for aviators, the current D2 series can display weather information (METARS and TAFs) as well as weather radar from an internet connected smartphone.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P84_S2	Other flight information capabilities include a moving map overlaid with the aircraft s position, HSI navigation, Zulu/UTC time and more.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P84_S3	With a built-in baro-adjustable altimeter, vibrating alerts based on altitude can be activated to remind a pilot to activate supplemental oxygen or perform other time critical tasks.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P84_S4	Multisport features include wrist-based heart rate monitoring, and smartwatch capabilities include notification and previews of phone calls, text messages, emails and more.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P85_S0	Our VIRB aviation action camera products provide pilots a comprehensive solution to record their flights, with the ability to integrate air traffic control communications to the audio recording, filter out prop distortion and overlay speed, altitude, G-force and more for enhanced post flight analysis.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P86_S0	Garmin Pilot is a premium, global app for iOS or Android mobile devices used for flight planning, filing a flight plan, in flight navigation, and automatic flight logging.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P86_S1	It offers a comprehensive and simplified experience to access a wealth of information during any particular phase of the flight including weight and balance, performance, and trip calculations, checklists, airport information, weather, traffic, 3D Vision virtual perspective view of surrounding terrain, a digital document viewer, a scratch pad, geo-referenced sectional and approach charts, wireless database updating, ADS-B weather and traffic as well as SiriusXM radio and weather (subscription required).
1121788_18_ITEM1_P86_S2	It incorporates global or regional navigation databases and charting options from Garmin as well as optional Jeppesen data and charts.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P86_S3	While internet connected, the app provides access to comprehensive global weather information, as available per region, that generally includes weather radar, weather report (METARS), forecasts (TAFs), weather alerts (AIRMETS/SIGMETS), pilot reports, satellite imagery (visible and IR), winds and temperature aloft, lightning data, and notices to airmen (NOTAM).
1121788_18_ITEM1_P86_S4	Garmin Pilot is the cornerstone of Garmin s connected cockpit, for example when connected wirelessly with G1000 NXi or GTN , a host of benefits become available including automated database updates for the avionics, flight plan transfer, weather and traffic streaming and much more.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P86_S5	Garmin Pilot is also wirelessly compatible with select aera series, D2 aviator watches, G3X Touch flight displays, GTX series transponders, VIRB action cameras and much more.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P87_S0	Garmin offers a wide selection of databases, extended warranties and subscription services to complement our products.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P87_S1	Our database offerings include Navigation Data, Obstacles, SafeTaxi enhanced airport diagrams, Terrain, Basemap and more.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P87_S2	Some of these databases are required by government regulations to be updated regularly for legal flight, and Garmin offers single updates as well as annual subscriptions for owners and operators to update all of an aircraft's qualifying avionics systems at a single price.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P87_S3	With a database subscription and compatible avionics, owners and operators can conveniently and wirelessly transfer the latest database updates to their avionics via a mobile device running our Garmin Pilot application.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P88_S0	Our aviation product support team has been honored with top awards from two of the leading independent avionics support surveys for 14 consecutive years.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P88_S1	To further our full product support beyond the standard product warranties, we also offer fixed price extended warranties for avionics and integrated flight decks that allow owners and operators peace of mind and predictable maintenance costs.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P88_S2	These further our standard warranty periods with world-class factory technical service, 24/7 aircraft-on-ground (AOG) emergency service and more.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P89_S0	Our comprehensive satellite datalink network subscriptions provide owners and operators with compatible avionics, a global weather, voice calling, text messaging and position reporting solution.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P90_S0	Global weather includes radar imagery, cloud cover, METARs, TAFs and much more for any point on the globe where the data is available (weather products vary by region).
1121788_18_ITEM1_P91_S0	Garmin s non-aviation products are sold in approximately 100 countries through a large worldwide network of independent dealers and distributors, who meet our sales and customer service qualifications.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P91_S1	No single customer s purchases represented 10% or more of Garmin s consolidated net sales in the years ended December 30, 2017, December 31, 2016, and December 26, 2015.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P92_S0	Marketing support is provided geographically from Garmin s offices around the world.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P92_S1	Garmin s distribution strategy is intended to increase Garmin s global penetration and presence while maintaining high quality standards to ensure end-user satisfaction.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P92_S2	Some of Garmin s larger consumer products dealers and distributors include:
1121788_18_ITEM1_P93_S0	Garmin s retrofit avionics and aviation portable products are sold through select aviation dealers around the world and, in the case of aviation portable products, also through catalogs and pilot shops.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P93_S1	Garmin s largest aviation dealers include Aircraft Spruce Specialty Co., Elliott Aviation, Gulf Coast Avionics Corp., Sarasota Avionics, and Sportsman s Market.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P93_S2	Avionics dealers have the training, equipment and certified staff required for installation of Garmin s avionics equipment.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P94_S0	In addition to the traditional distribution channels mentioned, Garmin has many relationships with original equipment manufacturers (OEMs).
1121788_18_ITEM1_P94_S1	In the auto segment, Garmin s products are sold globally to automotive and motorcycle OEMs, either directly or through tier 2 sourcing.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P94_S2	Some of Garmin s larger OEM relationships include BMW, Chrysler, Honda, Daimler (Mercedes Benz), Toyota, and Volkswagen.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P95_S0	In the marine segment, Garmin s products are standard equipment on various models of boats.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P95_S1	Some of the larger OEM relationships include Tiara, Ranger Tugs, Chaparral Boats, Inc., Cobalt Boats, LLC, Regal Marine Industries, Inc., Yellowfin Yachts, Hydrasports Boats, Viking Yachts, Bavaria Yachts, and Sea Hunt.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P96_S0	In the aviation market, Garmin s avionics are either standard equipment or options on various models of aircraft.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P96_S1	Some of the larger OEM relationships include Airbus Helicopters, Bombardier Business Aircraft, Bell Helicopter, Cirrus Aircraft, Daher, Diamond Aircraft, Embraer, Gulfstream Aerospace, Honda Aircraft, Leonardo Helicopters, Piper Aircraft, Quest Aircraft, Robinson Helicopter Company, Tecnam, and Textron Aviation.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P97_S0	In general, we operate in highly competitive markets though competitive conditions do vary among our diverse products and geographies.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P97_S1	Garmin believes the principal competitive factors impacting the market for its products are design, functionality, quality and reliability, customer service, brand, price, time-to-market and availability.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P97_S2	Garmin believes that it generally competes favorably in each of these areas and as such, is generally a significant competitor in each of our major markets.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P98_S0	Garmin believes that its principal competitors for portable automotive products are TomTom N.V. and MiTAC Digital Corporation (MiTAC) (which distributes products under the brand names of Magellan, Mio, and Navman).
1121788_18_ITEM1_P98_S1	Garmin believes that its principal competitors for infotainment solutions are Harman International Industries, Panasonic Corporation, and the Mitsubishi Group.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P98_S2	Garmin believes that its principal competitors for outdoor product lines are Vista Outdoor, Magellan, a subsidiary of MiTAC, SportDOG Brand, Suunto Oy and Dogtra Company.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P98_S3	Garmin believes that its principal competitors for fitness products are Apple Inc., Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd., Bryton Corp., Fitbit Inc., Polar Electro Oy, Sigma Sports, Suunto Oy and Wahoo Fitness.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P98_S4	For marine products, Garmin believes that its principal competitors are Furuno Electronic Company, the Humminbird division of Johnson Outdoors, Inc., Navico and Flir Systems, Inc.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P98_S5	For Garmin s aviation product lines, Garmin considers its principal competitors to be Aspen Avionics, Avidyne Corporation, CMC Electronics, Dynon Avionics, Appaero Systems, Genesys Aerosystems, Honeywell Aerospace Defense, Innovative Solutions and Support Inc., L-3 Avionics Systems, Rockwell Collins, Inc., Thales, Safran SA and Universal Avionics Systems Corporation.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P99_S0	Garmin s product innovations are driven by its strong emphasis on research and development and the close partnership between Garmin s engineering and manufacturing teams.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P99_S1	Garmin s products are created by its engineering and development staff, which numbered approximately 4,000 people worldwide as of December 30, 2017.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P99_S2	Garmin s manufacturing staff includes manufacturing process engineers who work closely with Garmin s design engineers to ensure manufacturability and manufacturing cost control for its products.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P99_S3	Garmin s development staff includes industrial designers, as well as software engineers, electrical engineers, mechanical engineers and cartographic engineers.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P99_S4	Garmin believes the industrial design of its products has played an important role in Garmin s success.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P99_S5	Once a development project is initiated and approved, a multi-disciplinary team is created to design the product and transition it into manufacturing.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P100_S0	Below is a table of Garmin s expenditures on research and development over the last three fiscal years.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P101_S0	Garmin believes one of its core competencies and strengths is its vertically integrated manufacturing capabilities at its Taiwan facilities in Xizhi, Jhongli and LinKou, its China facility in Yangzhou, and at its U.S. facilities in Olathe, Kansas and Salem, Oregon.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P101_S1	Garmin believes that its ownership and operation of its own manufacturing facilities and distribution networks provides significant capability and flexibility to address the breadth and depth of resources necessary to serve its diverse products and markets.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P102_S0	Specifically, Garmin believes that its vertical integration of its manufacturing capabilities provides advantages to product cost, quality and time to market.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P103_S0	Cost: Garmin s manufacturing resources rapidly and iteratively prototype designs, concepts, products and processes, achieving higher efficiency, resulting in lower cost.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P103_S1	Garmin s vertical integration approach enables leveraging our manufacturing resources across high, mid and low volume products.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P103_S2	Sharing of these resources across our product lines favorably affects Garmin s costs to produce its range of products, with lower volume products realizing the economies of scale of the high volume products.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P103_S3	The ownership and integration of our resources allows Garmin to optimize the design for manufacturing of our products, yielding improved cost.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P104_S0	Quality: Garmin s automation and sophisticated production processes provide in-service robustness and consistent reliability standards that enables Garmin to maintain strict process and quality control of the products manufactured, thereby improving the overall quality of our products.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P104_S1	Additionally, the immediate feedback throughout the manufacturing processes is provided to the development teams providing integrated continuous improvement throughout design and supply chain.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P105_S0	Garmin uses multi-disciplinary teams of design engineers, process engineers, and supply chain specialists to develop products, allowing them to quickly move from concept to manufacturing.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P105_S1	This integrated ownership provides inherent flexibility to enable faster time to market.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P106_S0	Garmin s design, manufacturing, distribution, and servicing processes in its U.S., Taiwan, China and U.K. facilities are certified to ISO 9001, an international quality standard developed by the International Organization for Standardization.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P106_S1	Garmin s automotive operations in Taiwan, China, U.K., and Olathe have achieved TS 16949 certification, a quality standard for automotive suppliers.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P106_S2	Garmin s Olathe and Salem aviation operations have achieved certification to AS9100, the quality standard for the aviation industry.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P107_S0	Garmin International, Inc., Garmin (Europe) Ltd. and Garmin Corporation have also achieved certification of their environmental management systems to the ISO 14001 standard, recognizing Garmin s systems and processes which minimize or prevent harmful effects on the environment and continually strive to improve its environmental performance.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P108_S0	Although most components essential to Garmin s business are generally available from multiple sources, certain key components are currently obtained by the Company from single or limited sources, which subjects Garmin to supply and pricing risks.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P108_S1	Many of these and other key components that are available from multiple sources, including, but not limited to, NAND flash memory, dynamic random access memory (DRAM), GPS chipsets and certain LCDs, are subject at times to industry-wide shortages and commodity pricing fluctuations.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P109_S0	Garmin and other participants in the personal computer, tablet, mobile communication, aviation electronics and consumer electronics industries also compete for various components with other industries that have experienced increased demand for their products.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P109_S1	In addition, Garmin uses some custom components that are not common to the rest of the personal computer, tablet, mobile communication and consumer electronics industries, and new products introduced by the Company often utilize custom components available from only one source until Garmin has evaluated whether there is a need for, and subsequently qualifies, additional suppliers.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P110_S0	When a component or product uses new technologies, initial capacity constraints may exist until the suppliers yields have matured or manufacturing capacity has increased.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P110_S1	Garmin makes efforts to manage risks in these areas through the use of supply agreements and safety stock for strategically important components.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P110_S2	Nevertheless, if Garmin s supply of a key single-sourced component for a new or existing product was delayed or constrained, if such components were available only at significantly higher prices, or if a key manufacturing vendor delayed shipments of completed products to Garmin, Garmin s financial condition and operating results could be materially adversely affected.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P110_S3	Garmin s business and financial performance could also be adversely affected depending on the time required to obtain sufficient quantities from the original source, or to identify and obtain sufficient quantities from an alternative source.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P110_S4	Continued availability of these components at acceptable prices, or at all, may be affected if those suppliers decided to concentrate on the production of common components instead of components customized to meet Garmin s requirements.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P111_S0	Our net sales are subject to seasonal fluctuation.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P111_S1	Sales of our consumer products are generally higher in the fourth quarter, due to increased demand during the holiday buying season, and, to a lesser extent, the second quarter, due to increased demand during the spring and summer season.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P111_S2	Sales of consumer products are also influenced by the timing of the release of new products.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P111_S3	Our aviation and auto OEM products do not experience much seasonal variation, but are more influenced by the timing of aircraft certifications and the release of new products when the initial demand is typically the strongest.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P112_S0	Our sales are generally of a consumer nature and there is a relatively short cycle between order and shipment.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P112_S1	Therefore, we believe that backlog information is not material to the understanding of our business.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P112_S2	We typically ship most orders within 72 hours of receipt.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P113_S0	Our success and ability to compete is dependent in part on our proprietary technology.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P113_S1	We rely on a combination of patent, copyright, trademark and trade secret laws, as well as confidentiality agreements, to establish and protect our proprietary rights.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P113_S2	In addition, Garmin often relies on licenses of intellectual property for use in its business.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P113_S3	For example, Garmin obtains licenses for digital cartography technology for use in our products from various sources.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P114_S0	As of January 5, 2018, Garmin s worldwide IP portfolio included over 1,100 patent and 750 trademark registrations.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P115_S0	The duration of patents varies in accordance with the provisions of applicable local law.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P115_S1	We believe that our continued success depends on the intellectual skills of our employees and their ability to continue to innovate.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P115_S2	Garmin will continue to file and prosecute patent applications when appropriate to attempt to protect Garmin s rights in its proprietary technologies.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P116_S0	There is no assurance that our current patents, or patents which we may later acquire, may successfully withstand any challenge, in whole or in part.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P116_S1	It is also possible that any patent issued to us may not provide us with any competitive advantages, or that the patents of others will preclude us from manufacturing and marketing certain products.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P117_S0	Despite our efforts to protect our proprietary rights, unauthorized parties may attempt to copy aspects of our products or to obtain and use information that we regard as proprietary.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P117_S1	Litigation may be necessary in the future to enforce our intellectual property rights, to protect our trade secrets, to determine the validity and scope of the proprietary rights of others or to defend against claims of infringement or invalidity.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P118_S0	The telecommunications industry is highly regulated, and the regulatory environment in which Garmin operates is subject to change.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P118_S1	In accordance with the United States Federal Communications Commission (FCC) rules and regulations, wireless transceiver products are required to be certified by the FCC and comparable authorities in foreign countries where they are sold.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P118_S2	Garmin s products sold in Europe are required to comply with relevant directives of the European Commission.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P118_S3	A delay in receiving required certifications for new products, or enhancements to Garmin s products, or losing certification for Garmin s existing products could adversely affect our business.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P118_S4	In addition, aviation products that are intended for installation in type certificated aircraft are required to be certified by the FAA, its European counterpart, the European Aviation Safety Agency, and other comparable organizations before they can be used in an aircraft.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P119_S0	Because Garmin Corporation, one of the Company s principal subsidiaries, is located in Taiwan, foreign exchange control laws and regulations of Taiwan with respect to remittances into and out of Taiwan may have an impact on Garmin s operations.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P119_S1	The Taiwan Foreign Exchange Control Statute, and regulations thereunder, provides that all foreign exchange transactions must be executed by banks designated to handle such business by the Ministry of Finance of Taiwan and by the Central Bank of the Republic of China (Taiwan), also referred to as the CBC.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P119_S2	Current regulations favor trade-related foreign exchange transactions.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P119_S3	Consequently, foreign currency earned from exports of merchandise and services may now be retained and used freely by exporters, while all foreign currency needed for the import of merchandise and services may be purchased freely from the designated foreign exchange banks.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P120_S0	Aside from trade-related foreign exchange transactions, Taiwan companies and residents may, without foreign exchange approval, remit outside and into Taiwan foreign currencies of up to $50 million and $5 million respectively, or their equivalent, each calendar year.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P120_S1	Currency conversions within the limits are processed by the designated banks and do not have to be reviewed and approved by the CBC.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P121_S0	The above limits apply to remittances involving a conversion between Taiwan Dollars and U.S. Dollars or other foreign currencies.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P121_S1	The CBC typically approves foreign exchange in excess of the limits if a party applies with the CBC for review and presents legitimate business reasons justifying the currency conversion.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P121_S2	A requirement is also imposed on all enterprises to register all medium and long-term foreign debt with the CBC.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P122_S0	Garmin s operations are subject to various environmental laws, including laws addressing air and water pollution and management of hazardous substances and wastes.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P122_S1	Substantial noncompliance with applicable environmental laws could have a material adverse effect on our business.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P123_S0	Capital expenditures for environmental controls are included in our normal capital budget.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P124_S0	Environmental regulation of Garmin s products is increasing.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P125_S0	Many of Garmin's products are subject to laws relating to the chemical and material composition of our products and their energy efficiency.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P125_S1	Garmin is also subject to laws requiring manufacturers to be financially responsible for collection, recovery and recycling of wastes from certain electronic products.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P125_S2	Compliance with current environmental laws does not have a material impact on our business, but the impact of future enactment of environmental laws cannot yet be fully determined and could be substantial.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P126_S0	Garmin has implemented multiple Environmental Management System (EMS) policies in accordance with the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) 14001 standard for Environmental Health and Safety Management.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P126_S1	Garmin s EMS policies set forth practices, standards, and procedures to ensure compliance with applicable environmental laws and regulations at Garmin s Kansas headquarters facility, Garmin s European headquarters facility, and Garmin s Taiwan and China manufacturing facilities.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P127_S0	Garmin continues to strive to reduce our carbon footprint by increasing our environmental sustainability efforts.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P127_S1	Our manufacturing locations have implemented increased recycling processes that keep all obsolete Garmin manufactured material from entering the waste stream.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P127_S2	Additionally, our new facility design has been constructed with energy efficient considerations, including reduced water consumption, LED lighting, and reflective roofing to deflect solar radiation.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P128_S0	As of December 30, 2017, Garmin had approximately 12,300 full and part-time employees worldwide, of whom approximately 4,700 were in North America, 5,100 were in Taiwan, 1,500 were in Europe, and 1,000 were in other global locations.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P128_S1	Except for some of Garmin s employees in Brazil and Sweden, none of Garmin s employees are represented by a labor union and none of Garmin's North American or Taiwan employees are covered by a collective bargaining agreement.
1121788_18_ITEM1_P129_S0	Garmin considers its employee relations to be positive.
1121788_18_ITEM1A_P0_S0	The risks described below are not the only ones facing our company.
1121788_18_ITEM1A_P0_S1	Additional risks and uncertainties not presently known to us or that we currently believe to be immaterial may also impair our business operations.
1121788_18_ITEM1A_P0_S2	If any of the following risks occur, our business, financial condition or operating results could be materially adversely affected.
1121788_18_ITEM1A_P1_S0	If we are not successful in the continued development, timely manufacture, and introduction of new products or product categories, demand for our products could decrease to the extent that lost sales and profits from declining segments or product categories are not entirely offset.
1121788_18_ITEM1A_P2_S0	We expect that a significant portion of our future revenue will continue to be derived from sales of newly introduced products.
1121788_18_ITEM1A_P2_S1	This is particularly important to replace sales and profits lost in declining segments or product categories.
1121788_18_ITEM1A_P3_S0	The market for our products is characterized by rapidly changing technology, evolving industry standards and changes in customer needs.
1121788_18_ITEM1A_P3_S1	If we fail to introduce new products, or to modify or improve our existing products, in response to changes in technology, industry standards or customer needs, our products could rapidly become less competitive or obsolete.
1121788_18_ITEM1A_P3_S2	We must continue to make significant investments in research and development in order to continue to develop new products, enhance existing products and achieve market acceptance for such products.
1121788_18_ITEM1A_P3_S3	However, there can be no assurance that development stage products will be successfully completed or, if developed, will achieve significant customer acceptance.
1121788_18_ITEM1A_P4_S0	If we are unable to successfully develop and introduce competitive new products, and enhance our existing products, our future results of operations would be adversely affected.
1121788_18_ITEM1A_P4_S1	Our pursuit of necessary technology may require substantial time and expense.
1121788_18_ITEM1A_P4_S2	We may need to license new technologies to respond to technological change.
1121788_18_ITEM1A_P4_S3	These licenses may not be available to us on terms that we can accept or may materially change the gross profits that we are able to obtain on our products.
1121788_18_ITEM1A_P4_S4	We may not succeed in adapting our products to new technologies as they emerge.
1121788_18_ITEM1A_P4_S5	Development and manufacturing schedules for technology products are difficult to predict, and there can be no assurance that we will achieve timely initial customer shipments of new products.
